Sublime bière brune aux reflets rubis avec une belle mousse ivoire à bulles très fines. Nez extrêmement surprenant avec un parfum de fleurs en toute première intention : rose, illet, lavande, bergamote, verveine, jacinthe, géranium voir chèvrefeuille. Cest impressionnant et je nose pas imaginer la quantité desters aromatiques différents que doit posséder cette bière ! Mis à part pour la Kagua Japonaise, je nai pas senti ceci ailleurs. Derrière cette débauche olfactive, du fruit avec la fraise des bois, la banane, le litchi, la mangue, la passion, la goyave. A peine ressent-on les arômes de malts qui pourtant doivent bien être quelque part ! Lalcool me semble être bien puissant avec ses 11% abv étant donné quon le devine facilement. Passons à la dégustation pour vraiment voir ce que cette bière a sous le capot. Première gorgé, premier bilan : lalcool colle une belle gifle, la levure est fine, bien droite, une petite amertume se dégage tandis quon sent enfin les malts et les houblons. La texture est légèrement sèche, moins ronde que ce à quoi on pourrait sattendre alors que la carbonatation est vive et intense pour une Quadrupel. La deuxième gorgée nous démontre que lalcool est lossature de cette bière et soutient toutes les flaveurs. On retrouve en arrière-bouche et rétro-olfaction des arômes de prune, de mirabelle, de pomme et de poire. De petites notes acidulées viennent nous titiller et donnent un caractère citronné/pétillant pas bégueule sur ce breuvage qui est relativement sucré. Le final va sorienter sur les bois et le cuir, la cire et la résine, les herbes sèches et le champ de blé au soleil. En soxydant et en chauffant un peu, on retrouve un peu plus de rondeur et les flaveurs de malts ainsi que du fruit. Cest bon, riche, plein de corps, long, étonnant, aromatique, floral, alcoolisé... Une bière quon ne qualifiera pas de parfaite car la perfection nest pas de ce Monde (et on se ferait chier !), mais que faire mis à part décerner la meilleure des notes ? Bouteille 33cl, Boissons du Monde, Saint-Egrève.

Very good and no distinct point I guess.

A great quad for cold winters.

Aroma is intensely fruity and malty with a mixture of raisins, plums, prunes, fig marmalade, molasses, candy sugar and diverging notes of apple, apple pie, cake and bread crust. Taste is intensely sweet and fruity, complex with nuanced flavors, and very well complimented by a boozy kick. Touches of wood and fruitcake can be felt as well. Perfectly rounded. Body is medium to big... a bit thinner than other Quads. Still, alcohol provides just enough presence, without overpowering. Carbonation is medium and the complexity is fairly high. Another nice Quad... probably my favorite style currently.

Some dough, but perhaps cleaner than expected from the aroma. Dried fruit - raisins macerated in brandy - , chocolate, very gently spicy bitterness. Pretty good, might mellow a bit over a year or two.

Indudablemente es buena cerveza y se disfruta mucho, pero ni llega al nivel de la clásica Rochefort ni supone nada que me vuele la cabeza.

Wondefully caramal full bodied Belgian quad. I love this style, and this is a great example. Delirium Cafe Brussels.

En bouche cest là que tout explose, cette bière est une tuerie, crèmeuse juste comme il faut, avec un goût de café froid mais surtout une amertume parfaite, subtile mais présente. Chose surprenante, on ne sent quasiment pas lalcool (en bouche) malgré ses 11°. Cette bière est une référence absolue.

Notes of red wine, brown sugar. Taste continues with the same notes. Dark fruits, some herbs, alcohol. Probably a bit too boozy for my liking. Palate is rich and full. Overall very enjoyable when drunk slowly.

Kolor:  Brązowy, klarowny.
Pod światło wyraźnie widać rubinowe refleksy.
 Piana:  Ogromna, drobniuteńka jak na azocie, puszysta, czapowata.
Bardzo długo utrzymuje się na powierzchni. Pęka do średnich ziarenek.
Kremowy puszek trwale oplata krawędzie Sensorica. Bardzo ładny lacing na ściankach. 
 Zapach:  Aromat z butelki jest bardzo delikatny. Czuć odrobinę ciemnych słodów, trochę winogron i rodzynek. 
W tle lekki karmel i brązowy cukier. 
W zasadzie to tyle. Zobaczymy, czy po ogrzaniu i przelaniu do szkła zmieni się coś w tej kwestii. 
 Smak:  W smaku wyraźnie słodkie. Króluje karmel, cukier trzcinowy, toffi i miód.
Dalej masa rodzynek, ciemnych winogron i kandyzowanymch owoców.
Klasycznie i smacznie.
Jest też kapka deserowej czekolady i odrobina orzechów.
Piwo jest pełne w smaku, ma likierowatą teksturę.
Alkohol wspaniale wklejony w całość. Nie czuć jego mocy, a zaledwie subtelne rozgrzewanie w piersi.
Quad momentalnie znika z kielicha.
Poezja dla moich kubków smakowych.

 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Bogaty smakowo, wybitnie słodowy, stylowy Quadrupel.
Stanowi ciakawą kompozycję nut słodkich (cukier trzcinowy, karmel, toffi) z owocowymi (ciemne winogrona, rodzynki, owoce kandyzowane).
Całość dopełnia czekolada deserowa i szczypta orzechów.
Alkohol subtelnie rozgrzewa, a piwo szybko znika ze szkła.
Dobra robota.

Generalnie jest słodkawe i owocowe, i mimo wszystko pijalne jak cholera. No ale umówmy się - to mój ulubiony styl piwa. Można brać w ciemno.

330 ml bottle bought at Gorgeous Wine & Cigar in Yuen Long.
Looks: Translucent Burgundy colour with a thin ring of yeast sediments; One finger head and crumpety light beige foam which lasts for 3 minutes; Beautiful sticky lacing with quite fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Fragrant and sweet dark malt, with light roastyness, almonds, strong caramel, sticky toffee, very light coffee, chocolate, cream, sugar, moderate alcohol, strong Bel yeast and light grass. 

Taste: Strong but pleasantly sweet dark malt, with moderate alcohol, light liquorices, plums, caramel, light toffee, Cola, chocolate, light coffee, sugar, strong Bel yeast, light lemon, moderate bitter hops and grass.

Body: Full body. Very creamy and slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Good dark maltyness in a rich, very smooth and silky background. Booze and sugar hit first but they do not scream nor warming, but rather in light touch and pleasant. Strong caramel mixed with Cola and light coffee. Quite yeasty and increasingly lemony to compliment the sweet booze. Its simple but the balancing work out just fine. Easy and nice!

Booze and Sweetness: The 11% abv is well hidden all the time, very well-managed and no knock on whatsoever. Incredible! Sweetness is strong but never cloying, as if its from chocolate bar. Very neat!

Hoppiness: Light grass in nose. Lemon and light grass in taste; Bitterness is fairly strong for a lasting, mid-astringent sweet booze finish.

After Taste: Fairly dry. Sweet, creamy and quite bitter to mouth.

Comments: Like its 9° Tripel brother, this Quad is simple in aroma and taste. Yet its foundation is rock solid, with beautiful looks and heads, very creamy body, very pleasant sweet malt, hidden booze and hoppy finish. It may not be as complex or colorful as La Trappe Quadrupel, but its very nice for chilling out. Recommended!

The Belgian yeast is a main contributor to the strong flavour as well, along with generic fruits, caramel, brown sugar, alcohol and spices including black pepper. I also get notes of dried dark fruits, but they are fainter than they tend to be for this beer style. The taste is moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Full body, surprisingly dry and with a rather lively carbonation. World class! 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 2.5 years before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Online]
Aroma of fruits, malt and vanilla. Taste of malt, raisins and some bread and wood (I think as well). A quality brew.
33 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours dark brown with a big beige head. Aromas of berries, fruits, hops, malts and spices. Taste is sweet. High carbonation. Quality brew.

0,33 bottle from systembolaget. - On the aroma this beer is heavy on the dark fruits. Slight leather and herbal hoppiness. Flavor is intense. Heavy on the dark fruits here as well. Tons of nuttiness, raisins. Not as dry as other quads, and i like that quite a lot. Delicious beer.
UPDATED: FEB 18, 2017 Wow. En af de sjove øl. Mrgrt fin og behagelig smag. Flot farve. For meget alkohol.

Bottle. Aroma of nuts and bread. Pours a very dark brown with off white head and some nice lacing. Taste is light to medium sweet. Full bodied with thick texture. Excellent brew, hard to believe it is 11%.

Flaske 330ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsdalen. Mørkebrun med et lite rødskjær. Høyt kremaktig skum som varer lenge. Pen lacing. God maltaroma med et lite hint av krydder. Smaken balansert. Mye malt. Lett søtlig krydder. Ender opp litt tørt. Alkoholen bra kamuflert men en merker den varmende effekten. Vel mye kullsyre.

11.2 oz. bottle. Pours dark brown with a large amount of uneven, golden taupe head. Great color of head. Good lacing. Yeasty, mineral aroma. Almost metallic in smell, unfortunately. Caramel, baked apple, and raisin (raw and cooked) scents. Dark malt flavor. A bit of roast. Tangerine. A metallic sweetness as well as some umami. Very subtle flavors. Lightly bitter aftertaste. Fizzy, lively, fluffy, and frothy in the palate. Easy to drink. Im not feeling this one, to my surprise. I hope it improves with age. Dark and complex. A very strong taste that has bitter and sweet tones, with a sweet aftertaste.

Mørk brun med høyt eggegult kremete skum. Lukter melkesjokolade, karamell, noe røyk og mørke frukter. Fyldig. Salt smak. Mot salmiakk lakris. Espresso og en fin fruktighet i bakgrunnen. Kjenner også belgisk gjær og noe stram alkohol mot slutten. Kort

Dark brown with creamy tan head. Chocolate, caramel, Belgian spice and coriander. Sweet, thick, slick and nutty finish. Overall: great quad!
Bottle. Dark redish brown with huge brown head. Sweet aroma of caramel and malts with a hint of sour barn. Sweet caramel taste with malts, toffee and alchohol flavours. Very sweet.

dark brown beer

Zeer donker, ondoorzichtig bruin bier met lichtbruine stevige schuimkraag.

M: Creamy texture, light feel for the strength. O: First beer in a long time where the first sip has made me sit up and take notice, seriously good.
UPDATED: JUL 16, 2016 Aroma of dark fruits, caramel. Big and long tan head, dark brown color. Tastes caramel sweet, yeasty, and a little bitter, well hidden alcohol. Full body, long finish.
On tap at the brewery on 9/11/15. Big dark brownish tan body. Tons of Deep toffee flavor. Slightly spicy up front, but finishes with a nice dark fruits/dates taste.

Smells like caramel, dried fruit, prunes, figs, raisins, some brandy, roasted rye, yeast, all that Belgian goodness. Surprisingly dry and light-bodied for a quad, and, together with a medium-high amount of carbonation, it goes down easy. Warm and bitter-sweet aftertaste.

Pours deep copper with off white lacing. Nose is brown sugar, dark fruits, and Belgian yeast. Flavor profile is similar and sharply carbonated with a lot of sweetness and darkness on the backside. warm but not boozy. long fairly sweet finish. very good quadruple.

Bottle from Blackrock cellar. Pours Chestnut brown with reddish hue. Foam tan head. Dark berry, bread, light spice, cherry, chocolate notes, plum, wood and earthy notes, raisins. On tap. Black with a bit of red color, tan head. Very heavy, intensive sweet, caramel taste. Aroma of cherries, cognac, bread. Very good.

Taste is a great mix between some candi sugar notes, some light dry fruits notes, heavy Belgian style malt with a light spicy/peppery finish. Body is quite full with good carbonation and no real apparent alcohol notes. Wonderful beer with just enough complexity and still retaining good drinkability.

.3l pour from chilled bottle into sniffer glass at Brickmakers in Vienna. Fairly aggressive pour produced a moderate and fizzy off-white head. Dark brownish red, nearly totally opaque, evident carbonation. Nose is a little earthy, some dark fruit (cherry?), some woodiness, and maybe even a little soy sauce. Body is full and fizzy. Sharp up front with strong carbonation throughout. I bet thatd mellow out with a little aging, and I think Id prefer it that way. Taste is licorice, plum, wood, maybe some dirt, raisin. Some pretty nice layers in there. Not too boozy, bitter, or sweet. Surprisingly balanced. Not a bad sipping beer.

Poured from bottle into a chalice glass
 Appearance- The beer pours a deep brownish color with a massive foamy cream colored head. The head has a fantastic level of retention, very slowly fading over time to leave a great showing of a foamy lace on the sides of the glass.
 Smell  The aroma is big of a dark fruit nature with raisin, plum, and fig. These dark fruits are mixed with molasses as well as a burnt candied sugar aromas. Along with all these smells comes other aromas of yeast cake, which brings with it some spice of clove and coriander. The alcohol is not hidden in this nose with a nice rum aroma present which when mixed with the rest of the smells gives a rather rich and warming smell overall.
 Taste  The taste begins with a rather rich dark fruit flavor or raisin and plum mixed with the sugary molasses and caramel tastes that were in the nose. There is a rather decent bit of a breadiness that is present right from the start as well, with other flavors of yeast and spice of coriander soon following. The sugary flavors start losing ground as the taste advances however with them being replaced by some more roasty bread and some boozy flavors or a rum like nature. All the while a little bit of a woody taste and some flavors of chocolate develop on the tongue. With the mix of flavors that are left at the end, an almost spiced and roasty fruit cake like flavor is left on the tongue.
 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is rather thin for an 11% abv quad with a carbonation level that was average. A little thicker of a body may have suited the fruitcake like flavors of the brew slightly better and keep it a slightly slower sipper (as it should be an 11%).
 Overall  This is a very tasty quad I must say. Other than the somewhat weak feel, it was really a fantastic beer to sip away. While not my favorite quad out there, I say definitely give it a try if you get a chance, as it is very good.

looks beautiful dark and a lot of sturdy foam which almost has the density of whipped cream in the smell there are dark malts and some red fruit flavor is very good dark malt sweetness caramel some fruitiness the alcohol only taste it faintly beautifully balanced quadrupel one of the better ones out there imo

I am very excited about this Quadrupel because it just is not as sweet as many of its kind. De Halve Maan have chosen a more hoppy and fruit tart interpretation of their Quadrupel, and it translates into a delicious aroma of dried fruit (prunes, raisins and figs) with wonderful flavor notes as dark chocolate, the aforementioned dried fruit, rye bread and dark caramel . Large vinous richness and a hoppy end contributing little citrus aftertaste. This makes the taste experience not so sweet as many beers of this type often can be. It is a beer for long-term enjoyment in good company.
Head diminishes slowly but has a nice creamy look. alcohol, resin, caramel, clear sweetness, lightly bitter. An easy enjoyable well balanced beer for its type but not particularly charismatic.
A heavy nose of banana, clove and spiced rum. Heavy and sweet with a burst of the candy sugar then a long, dry and herbal finish. Its very fizzy. With a nice boozy complexity in the finish.

Beautiful mahogany beer, with a head that is decent, but a bit thin. Amber Belgian malts with some clovey phenols and dark fruit aromas and flavor. Buzzy body accentuates the lovely flavors, and the alcohol is well ensconced in the beer. UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 Straffe Hendrik Brugs Quadrupel, uitgeschonken in 33cl. Gouden Carolus bokaal. Zwart bier. Meer chocolade. Zoeter en zwaarder als de tripel. Waarschijnlijk goed met zwaar vlees of wild zoals ook de La Trappe Quadrupel.

Smells like dark fruits, sugar and alcohol. Tastes like figs, chocolate, brown sugar, dough. An excellent complex beer, which will be appreciated by lots of people. I will try to age it and re-compare.

Doing a bit of backlogging here, notes from memory. Bottle at De Belgie in Hong Kong. Poured a murky dark brown with a one finger beige head into a trappist glass. Direttamente da Bruges una birra incredibile. 
Saltano subito al naso gli aromi di caffè e porto, luppolo assente.
La birra nel bicchiere è di colore scuro impenetrabile con un bel cappello di schiuma dorato e persistente.
In bocca si sprigiona tutto il suo carattere maltoso: cioccolato, caffè, una punta di liquerizia, uvetta e porto si uniscono per una bevuta gloriosa.
Carbonazione giustamente elevata, corpo pienissimo e bella sensazione alcolica in bocca; non esagerata, non stucchevole.
Una vera birra da meditazione e invecchiamento.

Excellent Quadrupel. Good balance, strength, aroma. Dark berries and caramel sweetness on the palate. Good.

Lovely quad, not the best one Ive tasted but well done.

330ml bottle, best before Nov 13. Pours very dark brown with a medium head. Aroma is raisin, caramel and molasses. Slightly vinous. Taste has caramel and red wine. Lots of dark red fruits. Slightly burnt finish.

Taste of dark malts, some dark fruits, bit spicy, unusual perfume ester notes, getting some dark chocolate, dab of treacle, complex
Palate - Soft carb, medium to full body, smooth. Sweet palate. Finish as main flavour, soft sweet smooth dark malt finish
Overall - Alcohol really well hidden. Complex. Some interesting notes in this quad - different to others Ive tried. Very good. Great to see this in the local supermarket.
Very dark, hazy brown. Thin head and sticky lacing. Aroma- liquorice, dandelion & burdock, sweetness. Taste reflects aroma. Thinner mouthfeel than expected and hides abv well. Classy brew.

330ml bottle served in a Trappist chalice.
A: Pours a nice deep brown color forming a huge creamy fluffy tan head. Very good retention and many lacings left. A nice creamy layer remains forever
S: Very malty and yeasty with notes of alcohol. Dark fruits like plums and raisins. Caramel and candy sugar. Classic Belgian yeasts
T: Follows the nose. A classic Belgian Quad, very creamy and molasses. Very bready too. Strong notes of caramel, caramel malts, dark fruits and Belgian yeasts. End is quite bitter with notes of flowery hope. Balanced bittersweet combination
M: Heavy creamy molasses body with good carbonation. Bittersweet Belgian style aftertaste
O: Great Quad. Excellent beer. Recommend
[ BA Review @ 10/7/2012 ]

Strong dark ale since 2010, also bottled in 75 cl bottles. Thick yellowish head, warm dark brown red colour. Complex aroma of bitter chocolate, gin, cream, blackcurrant, coffee, honey, liquorice. Soft, mellow, thick palate with soft fruitiness and pleasant yeasty spiciness on a full, creamy caramelly and chocolatey background, finishing in a roasted bitterness, herbal hops and warming, but not disturbing alcohol. Not sure if this is a quadrupel: to me, the roasted bitterness is just a bit too present not to be called a Scotch. But regardless of that, this is a very enjoyable winter warmer.

Pours a dark coffee brown with a light tan head. Aroma is cocoa, banana, and wood, taste is more pronounced oak and chocolate with a smooth, bittersweet finish. The alcohol is very well camoflauged. Overall a spectacular ale.

Bottle, shared by suurjuust, thanks! Pours very dark ruby with tan head. The head stays for some time. Aroma is sweet, dark fruits, plums, alcohol, caramel, spices. Flavor is sweet, dark fruits, plums, malt, some alcohol, and yeast. Overall: very nice brew.

Cloudy dark brown beer with a beautiful rocky off-white head. Beautiful lacing as well. Very nice complex aroma of roasty malts, caramel, dark fruits, alcohol and chocolate. Some raisins and wood in there as well. Taste is spicy and moderately sweet with a clear touch of the chocolate and the dark fruits. Maybe a tad too alcoholic, but not that disturbing. Some bitterness as well. Loveable warmishness in the aftertaste that goes accompanied with hints of the caramels and a nice mild bitterness that lasts for quite a while. Bit of an oily and sticky texture, medium bodied with a lively carbonation. Overall a pretty warming beer with a loveable taste. Like said before, maybe a bit too alcoholic, but yet it is quite drinkable as well... Nonetheless, I would love to have another bottle. Enjoyed it.

A: caramel, lots of alcohol, woody, roasty. Intense!
A: rocky head, brown foam, dark brown, cloudy.Beautiful head!
T: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, Intense again!
P: full body, creamy, licorice, long finish, bitter
O: adorei essa cerveja! Intensa em tudo, principalmente no alcool, no amargor e em um sabor forte que não consegui identificar, mas que adorei!

Color rubino con abbondante schiuma color cappuccino che lascia eleganti merletti su i bicchieri.
 Profumo di caramello mal ti frutta candita
 In bocca è riscaldata dal warming e dal corpo. è ricca di frutta finisce secche e amara

33cl bottle. Pours dark reddish brown with a thick creamy light beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, caramel, dark fruits, some banana. Taste is very similar, very well balanced and not too sweet. Some spices and light final bitterness with ground coffee notes. 11% ABV very well hidden and only noticeable as the beer warms up. Good quadruple but the competition in its style is very hard.
Bottle at home, Dark brown beer with a litle head. strong aroma. Fruity and alcohoic taste. A good strong beer.

Bottle at Belgisch Bierproeflokaal De Zotte, september 25th 2014. Dark brown body with a big tanned head. Dark fruity aroma with cocoa, caramel, mild yeast notes. Taste is lightly sweet, toffee, cherries, banana, pepper, mild alcohol notes. Strong fruity and caramel finish. A nice beer!

Dark amber/cider color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of toasted sweet malt, yeast, dark fruit, & spice; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, caramel, molasses, dark fruit (notably plums & figs), and some chocolate; Warm finish; Nicely balanced and complex; Very good.
Bottle. Dark pour with little head. Sweet aroma with prunes taking the forefront. Taste is sweet and again prunes are at the forefront. Body is medium to medium high.

Ruby tinged brown beer, tan head. Nose is dried fruit, plums, sugar, yeast, malt. Flavor is dried fruit, alcohol, dark sugar, chocolate, plums, spice, caramel. Alcohol in the finish. Oily mouthfeel. Rich, but very drinkable. Nice.
Bottle 0.33l from Delhaize supermarket Ghent Belgium.Pour it dark brown colour with small white head.Taste of black fruits, brown sugar and Belgian yeast.Perfect balanced.

Bottle. Aroma of raisins, molasses, fruit and alcohol. Dark brown, amber body with thin lasting head. Nice tan lacing. Flavor begins sweet, with subtle hints of bubble gum followed by raisin, molasses, dark bitter chocolate and a malty finish. Subtle coffee bean, bitter aftertaste.
Dark, very little head. Aroma of chocolat. Full body, no carbonation. Taste is sweet and fresh and a little bit bitter.
Draft at cedar grove NYC. Surprised to see it. Deep blackish purplish color. Head fades. Taste is sweet and syrupy with boozy finish

Bottled. Pours a raisin colored brown with a tan head. Little to no lacing. Aroma is raisins, mulled fruit, molasses, caramel, and chocolate. The flavor is slightly sweet like dark chocolate, raisins, some light dark fruits. Mouthfeel is nice. Incredibly drinkable. Almost no booziness. I will buy more next time.

Butilka: Deep ruby-amber coloured, almost clear, small and stable off-White foamy creamy layer; sweet raisins, molasses, sweet wine and caramel in the pretty complex nose, ornated by traces of chocolate; moderate to solid sweet and - subdued - bitter flavour, full bodied; lingering sweet-vinous and aramelly finish with some cacao in the very end. Good,good...

At the brewery in Bruges; nice very beer. Pours very dark; aroma of coffee ans chocolate. Very easy drinking for a quad with 11% alc. Maybe not as good as some of the others in the category, but still very good

Bottled. Pours a raisin colored brown with a tan head. Little to no lacing. Aroma is raisins, dark fruit, molasses, caramel, roasted maltiness, and chocolate. The flavor is chocolate, raisins, some light dark fruits. Mouthfeel is nice. Incredibly drinkable. Almost no booziness.
Bottle @ Den Tatoverede Enke, Copenhagen. Aroma: Yeasty, fruity, dried fruit. Taste: Yeasty, fruity, dried fruit, sweet, notes of chocolate(?). Body is full, warming alcohol in the finish.

Bottle. High creamy and lasting off-white head. Almost black very dark red brown body. Solid roasted malt caramel straw cocoa aroma and flavor with a nice hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long finish. Well balanced and the alcohol is hidden very well.

Bottle. Dark dark brown, zero light penetrates the beer. Frothy foam head. Aromas are quite fruity, potatoes, raisins, bubblegum. Boozy, sensation like breathing in hairspray. On to the taste. Sweet from the onset, cherries / cherry liquor, licorice, salmiak, dried apricorns, caramelized apples, gentle creaminess runs throughout. Sweet fruity high dominates. I would compare it to Gulden Draak, althought this is less fruity. Compared to Trappist beers, this is definitely much much fruitier. Interesting.

330ml bottle as a birthday present. Colour is very dark reddish brown, reddish tint, with a tan head. Aroma of dark caramel, and stewed fruit. Taste has dark fruits, chocolate, and surprisingly no alcohol!
Absolutely stonking! Give me a swimming pool of this Belgium lovelyness and dive right in from the 30 metre board!!

Dal colore marrone scuro con riflessi rosso rubino; schiuma abbondante, fine, cremosa e di buona persitenza. Aroma molto complesso, con prevalenza di fruttato (frutti rossi, mirtilli, ribes, more), accompagnato da picchi di caffè tostato e malto, con avvertenze liquorose. Al palato si mostra ancora di ottima complessità, sapori di frutti rossi (ciliegie), uva passa, frutti di bosco; il tutto è accompagnato da sapori leggermente tostati e frutta sotto spirito, buonissima la presenza liquorosa con sentori di Porto. Retrogusto lungo, buona carbonazione. Ottima produzione del birrificio de Halve Maan, e ottima anche la concorrenza ad altre produzioni di pari categoria.

Couleur chocolat, mousse tinté mais peu persistante, arôme malt, pain d'épice et alcool puissant ! Corps étrangement "léger" pour cette bière rassasiante et riche en bouche ! Saveur puissante de fruit rouge et surtout de zan... Un bon dessert alcoolisé !

Incredibly tasty and aromatic beer. Like a meal in itself, absolutely loved it!

Cest ma meilleure bière du monde, supérieure selon moi à la Westvleteren 12. Elle est riche et forte, complexe, elle a de la douceur et de la finesse, et une forte personnalité. Avec ses 11 degrés dalcool, il ne faut pas se tromper de moment pour la déguster !

This is my best beer in the world, in my opinion superior to the Westvleteren 12. It is rich and strong, complex, it has softness and delicacy, and a strong personality. And 11 degrees of alcohol, so choose carefully the right time to drink it!

Tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. The pour is clear, dark reddish brown with a big, tan head. Aroma has lots of dark dried fruits like plums, dates and figs. Also banana, toffee and a mild roast is present. Taste has a little licorice, but is carried by the same sweet fruits and caramel notes. Despite that, the licorice and freshness from the fruits are balancing it out quite nicely. Full body and medium to low carb. Pretty good, and maybe even underrated quad(compared to others) imo.
Ik drink normaal graag quadruple, maar dit was toch niet echt mijn smaak. Dan zijn er veel betere

Bottle, 11.2 oz. Nose is wonderfully quaddish, heavy dark malt overflowing with raisin and plum, sweet with fainter hints of cherry and smoke, fainter still the pear and peach, small touch of booze. Pours deep, dark red-brown with a very short, ephemeral tan head. Taste strongly sweet, all of the above with brown sugar in droves and a firmer sense of the alcohol involved, edging up into fume territory but not staying long, warming slowly and deliberately, hinting at port. Medium-full body with simple mouthfeel, not fizzy but the carb is short, and the malt depth isnt bottomless; very sugary but also picking up some light bitterness by the finish. Doesnt have massive complexity, and cloys at anything other than a snails pace, but a lot of intense flavor and fun.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2014 Ottima quadrupel. Dal colore marrone scuro con riflessi rosso rubino. Schiuma abbondante, persistente e fine, leggermente marroncina. Laroma mi ha lasciato interdetto: nei primi minuti si sentiva molto la polvere. Confido che non sia quello proprio della birra, quanto un difetto della bottiglia o del modo in cui mi è stata servita. A metà bicchiere ho avvertito però del piacevole liquoroso, nonché del buon maltato e fruttato. In bocca si avvertono soprattutto sentori di Porto, uva passa e prugna. Nella prima parte del sorso è una vera esplosione di sapori (fruttato, ma subito dopo il Porto). Leggero tostato nel finale. Retrogusto abbastanza persistente. Carbonizzazione notevole, ma non eccessiva. Non va assolutamente bevuta appena tolta dal frigo, come del resto ogni Quadrupel.

Bottle from Heinens shared with Brett, yeah it smells like dirt, and tastes very odd finishes dry and quickly with no lingering fruits or anything. I guess thats what their intent was but not all that enjoyable, alcohol is warming so thats a plus and it looks quad like.

Bottle. Pours cloudy intense yellow with a steady head. Aroma is deeply malt, clearly pasteurised. Body is quite light to medium for a quadruple. Taste is a bit of green hops, but also a light sour yoghurt pinch. A mediocre Belgian beer, 13 in a dozen. On the plus side, the alcohol warmth is well hidden.

Estamos ante una cerveza compleja pero bien equilibrada, de color oscuro y reflejos rubí intensos, buena formación de espuma y alta estabilidad. Lo primero de todo es que tengo que decir que en el sabor presentaba notas de oxidación pero nada lo suficientemente intenso como para que arruinase una cerveza que en su conjunto me ha parecido muy completa. En aroma destaca la malta que nos recuerda a frutas oscuras y muy maduras como las uvas pasas y los dátiles y el lúpulo hace acto de presencia pero no destaca mucho y se mantiene en un segundo plano. En boca las caracter´siticas son muy similares aunque se potencian y aparece las notas alcohólicas aunque muy bien integradas, esto también ayuda a potenciar la sensación de amargor. Su cuerpo es denso y su carbonatación justa. En el retrogusto deja una sensación de leve dulzor residual y el alcohol ayuda a templar el paladar. (Botella, 330 ml)

Oh why can't I rate a beer without comment??? This beer is definitely best taste very very cold which yields a pleasant caramel aroma and a rich full flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Deep red-brown with a large foamy tan head. Aroma is densely malty, honey, liquorice. Flavour is big and rich--sweet malts, chocolate, caramelised sugar, yeast. Warming. This is nice.

Very nice. Smokey basement musk with a faint hint of chocolate. Pours dark cloudy brown with ok head and lacing. Light sour finish and a little bitter. Full aroma with some light floral yeast and hints of dried fruits. Some caramel. Bottle from De Vinos.

Bottle 33cl. Dark brown, near black with a light brown head. Aroma has caramel and sweetness. Not too special. But then you taste it and you?re taken to a lovely world of caramel, warmness, chocolate, coffee(?) and lots more. Lots of Co2 too. But it?s all balanced. This beer is art.

Bottle @ home. Bought from the brewery in 2012, enjoyed July 2014. Dark brown beer with a lacy head. Enjoyable quad. Obviously not as complex as R10 but a couple years aging has done good for the beer as its rounder and more enjoyable than fresh sample had in 2012.
Excel·lent cervesa quadrupel a la altura de la rochefort 10 i la st bernardus 12 abt. Boníssima.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2016 
Aroma:

Malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dark fruit and liquorice.

Appearance:

Hazy/turbid ruby/brown beer with a medium off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dark fruit and liquorice.
bottle. Dark brown, almost black with massive tan head. Black cherry and berries. Very fruity and sweet, but not cloying. Booze well hidden. Delicious quad.

750ml corked bottle pours almost black in color with a 2 finger light brown head that leaves some nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is dark fruits and chocolate with hints of licorice. Taste is dark fruit and chocolate malty sweetness with a herbal bitterness. Medium bodied with generous carbonation leaving a very pleasant sensation on the palate. Nicely done and recommended.

Bottle @ Den Tatoverede Enke, Copenhagen 16/7-14. Fruity with notes of dried fruit and alcohol, sweet and light caramely, medium to full body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and medium bitter with notes of alcohol.

Frische Flasche (33 cl) von Belgianbeerz.com. - Rötliches Kastanienbraun, enorme Schaumentwicklung. - In der Nase typische obergärig-esterige Fruchtigkeit, brauner Zucker und eine leicht weinige Note (Portwein). - Antrunk schwer dunkelmalzig, mit leicht sirupähnlicher aber noch gut eingebundener Malzsüße und Noten von reifen Pflaumen, Kirsche und Karamel, dazu ein Hauch von Weihnachtsgewürzen. Mild rezent, vollmundig, samtig im Mund. Im Abgang geschickt abgerundet durch nicht besonders kräftige aber deutliche krautig-holzige Hopfenherbe. - Sehr angenehmes Quad, wenngleich keine geschmackliche Offenbarung. Hätte durch längere Lagerung wahrscheinlich gewonnen.
12oz bottle at Woodruff's. Pours a dark brown color with a lot of frothy head. Mildly sweet and lots of caramel.

750 ml bottle purchased at Liquor Shed in Casper, $11.99

Another powerful pop when I removed the cage and cork. No spillage.

Lots of foam so Im waiting for that to settle down. Okay, it has a deep brown kind of mahogany colour to it, looks to be clear. The foam is off white bordering on tan. I see nice lacing.

I smell some sweet goodness. Caramel malt that fades into a port like nose that also has some fruity aromas going on. Thats not all; I get some notes of chocolate and some cherries. Some alcohol as well but its pretty well masked.

The taste is less sweet than I would have guessed. A port like flavour greets me at the door followed by toffee, figs, some cherries that add a mere hint of tartness. I also get more than a hint of the abv...lots of warming ensues. I wish more of the Port stood out but this is certainly tasty enough without that happening.

Despite the big pop on opening and the great looking foam I see after every pour, Id call the carbonation on the near delicate side. 

This is a beer and brewery that Ive never even heard about, probably saw it on the shelves in FT Collins but never noticed, but I really like this one a lot. It has a comforting feel to it.

Bottle, bb 11-2015. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma: brown sugar, boozy, dark fruits. Taste: chocolate, dark fruits, vanilla, espresso, hint of mint, cinnamon, pepper. Sweet, some bitterness in the finish. Creamy, medium to full body, well carbonated. Sweet and bitter boozy (brown rum?) finish.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2014 Dark brown beer with a litle head.
Strong beer, fruity smels. Taste like fruit and some  strong alcohol. A good strong beer.
Deep brown. Aroma is candied malt. Taste is dark fruits, BOOZE, malty yeastiness, strong sweetness. Finish is almost sickly with some bitterness on the tail end. Like a less complex Rochefort.
Flott skum, fyldig smak, morsom øl som man ikke drikker mange av. Smakte denne i Cornwall

Vörösesbarna színe és krémszerű, rövid életű habja van, mely egy pár milliméter vastagságú gyűrű formájában mindvégig megmarad a pohár falán. Telt és gazdag illatok tömkelegét fedezhetjük fel benne, aszalt gyümölcsök, szilva, narancs képei sejlenek fel, édeskés, süteményes fűszerek aromái áradnak belőle. Kellőképpen sokszínű ízvilágának alapvető jellemzője a likőrös, de ésszerű keretek között megmaradó, elegánsan édeskés, marcipános jelleg az alkohol hangsúlyos és melengető jelenlétével.

Pours dark dark brown with low off white head
Aromas of belgo yeast, mud, molasses, 
Taste is peppery, has notes of belgo yeast, spices

Pours deep brown to black with medium off-white head. Aroma of raisins, figs, rye bread, spices. Taste is very spicy and peppery, sweet with dark fruit in the finish. Body is rich and creamy with soft carbonation.

Pours black with a medium creamy tan head. Aromas of caramel, raisins, roasted malts, roasted nuts, brown sugar. Taste is caramel, roasted malts, raisins, roasted nuts, brown sugar. Mouthfeel is medium body with medium carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a very dark brown, reddish tint, with a massive soft, solid cream head. Looks fantastic. Taste does not disappoint! Dark red fruits, chocolate, no alcohol taste at all. Wow. One of my favorite beers of late!

Medium brown head. Hazy dark brown body. Malty rock sugar and spice aroma with licorice notes. Sweet, and somewhat dry, licorice and spice taste with herbal cinnamon notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft mouthfeel. Dryish spicy cinnamon and toasted sugar aftertaste with vanilla and minerals notes. Nice and drinkable. Aftertaste is perhaps a bit short. (0.75l bottle, shared at de Vlaamsche Pot, Bruges.)
Bottle from Total Wine. Pours dark, dark mahogany with a billowy tan head. Taste is full of dried fruits with some lingering chocolate and alcohol. Full mouthfeel and nice carbonation.
Mahognyfärgad öl med lätt beige skum. Doften är kryddig, jästig, fikon, torkad frukt och karamellsötma. Samma återkommer i smaken.

330 mml bottle tasted on 14/06/2014. Dark brown colour with a bubbly beige head. Aroma is intensive on caramel, dark fruits and hops. Taste is deep caramel and light coffee. Body is full and carbonation is medium. Aftertaste is a little chocolate and dry. Next one please!
Tasty quadrupel. Body of sweet malt of course, with lots of dark fruit and herbs. High on alcohol, but thats not present in the taste. Good beer.

11.2 oz bottle. 2012 release, aged ~2 years. Pours brown, almost mahogany and translucent. Plenty of carbonation, decent lacing. Aroma improves as it warms, kind of muted when its cold. I agree with description regarding palate and tastes...palate is just a bit dry. I messed up and didnt taste this beer fresh, so its hard to compare 2 years old, but its great after aging! I really like this brewery, pretty much everything Ive had from them is awesome.

Jeg er desværre ikke videre imponeret. Udseende og aroma lover en quadrupel og procenten lover også godt, men man bliver desværre mødt af en omgang forvirring rent smagsmæssigt. Svage frugt nuancer blandet med en mærkelig citrus, der efterlader én med en træls (!) fornemmelse af opvaskevand.. Og det er ikke videre godt!
Drank with Hugo 9-6-2014. Really liked this beer. Chocolate all over. A bit thick was is nice. Soft, little carbonation.

11.2oz bottle in a tulip. Pours deep brown with a lacy, beige head. Aroma of caramel and chocolate and some toffee from the malts, spicy Belgian yeast, hints of dark fruits, some sweetness, hints of nuts/grains, and a very light bitterness. Flavor the same, with a nice blend of everything for a Belgian quad. Smoother texture. Pretty good but not the best of its style.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours dark brown, light fruits, esters, dry toffee, quite sweet.

Bottle. Very dark. Not as fruity as expected but more spice taste. A little drier than other quads I've tasted but still on sweet side. Overall very good quad. I would buy again

Deep dark brown color with beige head. Aroma of dried fruits, toffee, caramel and some hops. The taste has sweet notes, toast, and dried fruit with a soft alcoholic touch. Bitter finish with dark chocolate hints. Great Quad!
You can smell the alcohol with the caramel. The alcohol is a little bit unbalanced at the taste. Strong, full body.

Rusty brown with a fluffy beige head. Aroma is raisins, brown sugar, apricot, dates, honey, caramel. Full bodied, sweet and complex on the palate, long finish with a little booze. Flavours are raisins, brown sugar, toffee.

Bottle to tulip
Blackberry, plum, molasses, bread, yeast, and apple.
Deep reddish amber, almost brown, with a long lasting frothy tan head. Taste is bread, yeast, alcohol, plum, clove, and red pepper.

Very dark brown, beige head, decent lacing though not as good as some quads. Ripe fruit and alcohol on the nose more than malt - sherry, raisins. Brown sugary - sweet, but balanced with toffee and some spice.

Une bière assez goutue, avec une couleur très sombre. Des arômes de malt grillé. Fruits rouges, chocolat, une bière avec du corps, on sent bien lalcool une texture assez lourde et huileuse. Une petite amertume qui reste en bouche. Pour ceux qui aiment les bières fortes
Molasses nose. Smells like it'll be a thick and syrupy barrel aged stout. Plum taste, very sweet.

Bottle pour. Dark brown with limited head. Nose is candied plums, molasses and port. Taste is raison bread, brown sugar, grape skin bitterness. Generally complex. And sweet. Oh, god, this is sweet. Lots of booze.
330ml bottle. Dark brown body with a low tan head. Chocolate, dried fruit, fudge, vanilla and alcohol.
Bottle in Bruges. Packed with flavour, caramel, malt, prunes, raisins, some bitterness, too, but firmly on the sweet side. Pleasant beer for sipping. Highly drinkable.

Bottle at Kaisla, Helsinki. Pours dark brown with a little white head. Aroma has ripe, dark fruitiness, raisin, sweet caramel maltiness and, uncharacteristically, also a solid presence of vanilla and oak. Taste is strong, sweet and quite intense. Sweet malty notes, raisin and vanilla carry the taste towards the long, very light bitter finish. Again, the intriguing element of vanilla appears; coupled with sweet, ripe fruitiness the impression is slightly sherryish. The palate is full-bodied and sticky with a fairly soft carbonation. An elegant, varied quad overall.

Deep brown, almost black with a beatutiful beige head. Aroma: dark fruits and alcohol. Taste: fruits in the beginning, caramel, toffee and coffee in the end. Sweet and delicious aftertaste. Very enjoyable.
330 ml bottle pours dark brown with tan head. Aroma is subtle alcoholic and sweet. Slight dusty and malty, a bit raw. Taste is sweet of syrup then bitter caramel. Slight coffee aftertaste.

330ml bottle from Les Crepes de Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours very dark brown with decent head. Rich, dark and strong tasting with soothing hints of chocolate and a swirling complexity that brings malts, raisins, brown sugar and a teasing sweetness. Exceedingly drinkable given its a belting 11%, with light touches of flavours that are in no way overpowering like some of its quadruple brethren. Lovely stuff.

Bottle from Belgium, deep dark brown with a fast-settling tan head, too gassy, toffee and pear-drops aromas, dry-sweet and almost syrupy in texture, palate has burnt caramel, bitter hops and toffeeish malt. Tastes strong, but more like say 8% than 11%. Finish is burnt-bitter, alcoholic and a bit cloying-sweet.
Zwaar biertje, redelijk zoet, met opvallend veel koolzuur. Zoete geur. Diepte kon ik niet goed proeven wegens verkoudheid. (Met Suus in Louis Hartloper).
Bottle bought in Belgium. Very big head.Dark brown. 11 % ABV. Surprisingly limited aroma and taste. Also not very alcoholic taste. A bit fenolic. Would maybe gain if aged (Best before 2017).

24.04.2014, 0,33l bottle @ BBGTC tasting:
Big fizzy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, caramel malts, raisins, sugar, grass, hay, "knekk", toffee, hints of almond essence. Taste is sweet and medical harsh, caramel malts, almond essence, hay, grass, burnt caramel, licorice, cardboard, dried, burnt grain. Medium bitterness, dry harsh mouthfeel. Meh!

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Dark brown color when held towards the light. Large head with very good retention and lacing.
Sweet malt and brown sugar in the aroma. Also quite boozy.
After tasting I was surprised. It wasnt as sweet as I expected, and I liked that. Also it didnt feel like 11% ABV.
Medium body with light carbonation. Easy to drink in spite of the high ABV.

Overall a very nice quad, I enjoyed it more than some of the bigger names.
Coppery amber with a tan head. Sugary sweet aroma with light bready notes. Taste is grainy with light toasted malts. Somewhat harsh, but still sweet. Full bodied with close to high levels of co2.

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Pours a clear dark mahogany body with a red hue and a medium creamy head. Aroma is raisins, dark sugars, rum, mild plums and hints of caramel, cinnamon and rum. Taste is caramel, dark sugars, raisins, burnt sugar and hints of grains and alcohol. Medium to full body, medium to high carbonation. Quite a nice quad, but a bit sugary and lacks a bit in complexity for the high scores.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2014 (Drinking date: 22 April 2014) Pitchblack colour with no foam. Nice aroma of ripe dark fruits and chocolate and salted liqorice and alcohol. But could have been more intense. The taste is nice. It starts sweet and it ends bitter, with a kind of liqorice-sweetness. The mouthfeel is not really good. The body is too watery, and the carbonation too heavy. I would have liked a more full body and with a less intense carbonation. Overall this is a good and delicious beer, but not the best and most delicious quad that exists. The aroma could have been more intense and the mouthfeel should have been better. But still a good one! That?s why I give it the total score of 3.7!

Bona quadrupel, tot i que es nota molt lalcohol. Recomanable predre-la poc a poc per descobrir diferents matissos.
Buena quadrupel, aunque se nota mucho el alcohol. Recomendable tomarla despacio para descubrir diferentes matices.

Malty aroma with slight fruitiness like raisons. Poured light from bottle with barely any head. Clear coffee brown with edges of gold. Fantastic malty quad flavor. Light on the palate. Strong alcohol with sweet lasting after taste. This is a worthwhile Belgian quad. I will gladly drink this again!

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks beerandbeyond. Pours brown to orange with a nice head, aroma of fruits, yogurt and a apricot, flavor is sourish and very sweet with fruits and alcohol, medium bodied.

2010 vintage, carefully cellared at my local distributors warehouse. Pours dark brown with a fair amount of sediment and a khaki head that settles down to a thicker ring and leaves some spots of soapy lace. Nose involves dark candy sugar, some caramel apple, brown bread, pinot noir, some alc vapors, plums. Quite sweet, somewhat bitter, a touch tart. Full bodied, chewy texture, oily, fair action, some alc heat, with a drying toasty bitter finish. Pretty badass, I must say. Lots of cool shit going on. Restrained, yet powerful.
UPDATED: MAY 1, 2017 Een lekker, donker bier. Koffie, hop, houtskool. Deze quadrupel is niet te zwaar. Drink hem rond de 10 graden Celsius.

Bottle. Pours black with big creamy beige head that lasts and leaves great lace. Rich aroma of caramel, toasted malts and bread dough of which the caramel is well represented in the flavor. Medium sweet and lightly bitter tastes. Average carbonation, chewy to oily texture, sweet candy and chocolate flavors, medium body and a smooth sweet finish. Hides the alcohol well. Yummy!
Bottle. Dark brown color with a medium thick frothy off-white head. Aroma of raisin, caramel, vanilla and yeast. Bitter and sweet taste. A bit harsh finish.

28/03/2014 La Tana (330ml bottle). Bruna, intensa, abbastanza limpida, schiuma bianco-sporca abbondante e persistente. Al naso iniziale, sgradevole nota metallica, che fortunatamente si attenua nel tempo fin quasi a sparire, quindi emergono note di zucchero di canna, frutta rossa (ciliegie), caramello e spezie. In bocca è discretamente complessa, rotonda, dolciastra allattacco con un finale acidulo (frutta rossa, ciliegie, ribes) e leggermente amarognolo. Corpo pieno, carbonazione media. Bella birra di sostanza.
Superbe réussite encore une fois. Belle couleur foncée, bière maltée à souhaits, arômes dalcool de fruits, quelques notes grillées et épicées. Les 11% sont par contre très violents.
On tap. Cloudy red with creamy tan foam. Lots of lacing. Aroma of peach, pear, and apple. Fruit flavors are sweet and pronounced. Alcohol is drying. Finish is not as sweet with a hint of apple.

Bottle from Brune Rousse Houblon, Nice. 

Dark brown with a small creamy tan head. Sweetish aroma of malt, dried fruit, caramel and some notes of alcohol. The taste was similar and vinous. The body was full. The finish was fairly long and with warming alcohol.
Quick rate to remember buy this also on next trip to Belgian border. Great quadruppel, full of dark fruity aromas, rich bodied and balanced.
Dark brow, almost black with small, lasting offwhite head. Sweetish aroma, raisins and alcohol. Mothfeel is creamy, malt and caramel. Not too sweet, moderately boozy. Dry but sticky finish.
750ml bottle. Lasting yellowish head atop a near opaque brown black body. Nose of alcohol, corn candy and cat puke. Fairly sweet, spiced, buttery and burnt brown sugar.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, sehr fruchtig, reife Früchte, alkoholisch. Geschmack stark fruchtig, dunkle überreife Früchte, leicht röstmalzig, alkoholisch.

Robe noire aux reflets ruby, carbo importante, col genereux de fines bulles, belle dentelle.
Aromes fruités(poire, prune), caramel, note grillés et alcool.
Bien ronde et genereuse, huileuse, pointe amertume en final.
On snet passer les 11°...

UPDATED: FEB 29, 2016 Donkerbruin, tegen het zwart aan, bier met rijke romige crèmekleurige schuimkraag. Heerlijk vol aroma. Je ruikt drop, caramel, rozijnen, chocolade. Heerlijk intense, volle smaak (licht zoetig) Bier met een stevig karakter. Smaken van mout, gebrande koffie, peperkoek, kruiden, toffee, chocolade. Heel uitgebreid smakenpallet, er gebeurt heel veel in de mond. En dan die afdronk !! Dit bier proef je door en door !! Meesterwerkje dit !!
very strong and full taste that hints to stout but is still a quadrupel. The after taste stays long in the mouth, bitter but creamy. Surprising beer !

Bottle. Clear dark brown pour, lasting rich dark head and an aroma of raisins, plums and noticeable alcohol. Flavor is nice rich plums, creamy dark malt, toffee and finished with some clover and alcohol. Pretty solid and worth the $4/bottle.

33 cl, flaske, 11,0 %, købt i Den Belgiske Ølbutik i Vanløse, 10. marts 2014.
Mørkebrun ufiltreret Quadrupel med stor fint boblende moccafarvet skumtop på 4 cm tykkelse. 
En overraskende svag aroma for øl i denne klasse, men lidt duft af gær og lidt malt.
Til gengæld en meget fyldig og rund smag med et ekstremt veltilpasset balance mellem sødme og bitterhed. Lang dyb eftersmag med god alkoholvarme. Smagen har sødme af brun farin, gætter jeg på, gær og masser af malt. 
Den store skumtop i starten fordrejer en til at tro, at der er overmåde meget kulsyre i øllet, men dette er ikke tilfældet. Indholdet er på middel niveau og virker alligevel meget passende til smagen. 
Virkelig velsmagende!
Dark brown colour. Sweet malts, dark fruits, caramel, fruity, a nice quadrupel.

Dark brown quadruple with creamy off white head. Red fruits and above all roasty aromas: coffee and chocolate. In mouth it is quite bitter and salty (unbalanced). Vanilla and toffe flavor are perceived and a warm sensation because of the alcohol. The end is long dry and excessively bitter

Filip

33cl bottle from La Maison Belge, Puerto de la Cruz. Pours dark brown with a tan head, Sweet, malty and caramelly with some fruity notes. A bit too sweet and caramelly for my taste, but certainly a decent brew. (2014-02-15 - Halden)
On tap @ Doerak (2009). Dark brown/red with a off white head. Aroma of sweet malts, almost bourbon like. Taste is sweet malts, alcohol, almost bourbon BA. Very nice.
Bottle at the brewpub. Pours dark brown to black with thin brown head. Aroma is lots of licorice, spices, a bit of malt. Flavor is licorice, malt, roasty, spicy. Very strong in flavor.
Bottle @tasting, pours brown/red, light off white head. Little on the nose but you do get that traditional belgium spice. On the tongue, fruity, chocolate, banana bread, nice.

Bottle to snifter. Pours a deep, dark amber with thin, carmel head. Not much head retention. Aroma of sweet, roasted mild malt with suttle sour fruit and booze. Taste is roasty malt, light fruit, scotch booze, then a coca finish. Very little booze, not overpowering, malts are very well balanced. Awesome quad

Bottle.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks tomer. Murky and very dark brown with beige head. Vinous, sweet aroma, sweet vinous taste. Full-bodied, carbonated and, well, vinous finish. Nice.

Snow day beer. Pours deep dark brown with ample tan head. Scent is grain, dark fruit, molasses, and candy. Sweet front end with dry back. Medium thick body with appropriate level of carbonation. Draft - Brick Store Pub - Decatur, Georgia

Sample shared by a friend. Dark brown pour with a thin beige head that recedes quickly to a wispy film. Short strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of roasted malt, dark fruit and chocolate. Full-bodied and somewhat chewy with flavors of chocolate malt, plums, caramel and yeast. The finish is fruity up front with a toasted malt aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

Very nice dark fruity flavors, grapes, Plums, raisins. Nice alcohol burn... very inviting, like a barrel aged quad. Tastes of vanilla, hints of chocolate, and toffee. Aroma is beautiful and pleasureful. Malt complexity of a well crafted Belgian brew. I love this beer and it only gets better with age.

750ml Bottle. the aroma is very sweet and alcoholic - my first thought was that it smells like port. Threes raisins, chocolates and caramel in there as well as more fruitiness. It pours a dark brown almost black body with a thick lasting light tan head. Its taste is very similar to the smell with chocolate more to the fore and with burnt toast in there too. It has a bitter sweet finish. Not as sickly sweet as a lot of strong Belgian beers. Didnt think Id like this one - but I was wrong!
Bottle. Dark brown with large beige foamy head, caramel aroma, high carbonation, roasted malt taste, full body, very balanced long finish. The strong alcohol content is very nicely balanced.

33cl bottle
Appearance: Transparent reish brown pour, thin unstable cloudy head
Aroma: Belgian yeast, Esters, red fruit fruit.
Taste: Bittersweet with dark fruits, a hint of chocolate and caramelised malts. In the finish it shows some light spices and the alcohol peaks just a bit too much trough.


medium body, Oily Texture (less smooth as the heritage version.), medium carbonation,
Bottle at Craigs. Reddish brown pour, thin off-white head. Big Belgian yeastiness, some banana. Dried fruit. Taste is big and chewy. Sweet, warming finish. Nice.
Bottle. Dark brown with tan head. Aroma of dried3d fruits, belgian yeast esters. Taste of dark fruits, toffee, yeast and nuts. Sweet and bitter, not really my bag.

Potent, overwhelming beer, deep and complex, that has a wide profile combining notes to almonds, cake, milk chocolate, prunes and red wine with some bitterness which is close to spiciness. The overall is robust, well rounded and finished, with a spicy hint in the finish. The cons: the texture could be smoother and not so watery and the red wine notes are too marked. Nothingless, a very good beer, to repeat.

Appearance: Clear dark brown with ruby highlights and 3 finger thick ivory/tan head.
Aroma: Bubblegum, banana, mineral, woody, spiritous, toast/bread.
Taste: Low/medium sweetness and bitterness, medium sourness.
Palate: Light smooth texture, light airy body, prickly carbonation, dry abrupt malty fruity, spicy finish with a slight alcohol warmth.
Comments: Lovely and glass lace.

Bottle BB 2016. Dark red/brown beer, mostly opaque, sparkling, huge foamy beige head with nice lacing. Smell - sweet dried fruits, red berries and ribena, a touch of alcohol. Body is medium but very foamy. Taste - very sweet malts, sharp alcohol with a dark fruit and coffee vibe. Nice.

Pours reddish brown, dark, very minimal head. Nose is sweet, dark fruits, raisin, booze, maybe chocolate, rich malts, very aromatic. Taste is dark fruits, raisin, dried figs, chewy, a touch of chocolate, caramel malts, candy sugar. A little too boozy for me, but very complex and a good sipping beer.

Bottle. Poured into a trappist glass. A sugary malt scent upon pour. Almost no head. Surprisingly smooth and not as heavily bodied as I thought it might be. Slight cherry taste with a bit of chocolate. Warm as it hits the chest. Potent in the alcohol department. Definitely a sipping beer but enjoyable and very tasty.

330ml bottle from 1420, León.
In short: a boozy belgian quad.
Pours hazy dark copper-amber with frothy tan head, good head retention, some lacing. Roasty, liquor, caramel, nuts aromas. Medium body, viscous texture, average carbonation. Taste is sweet, liquor notes, caramel, roasted flavours, spicy, all among a nice alcoholic load. Despite this is quite well balanced. Very enjoyable.

Aroma - aroma is of caramel, dark fruit sugars, and spice.
Appearance - super dark brown, liquid is clean, the head originally frothy and then settles into a fluffy moat that also laces down around the edges of the glass. Head is somewhat off white.
Taste - the beer is more on the medium sweet side. Notes of dark fruit, spice and burnt sugar are present, rich alcohol is also abundant.
Palate - the body is of medium to full nature, the texture slick and thick, nuances of sticky as well. The carbonation lively in the tongue. The finish bitter and full of booze.

A hell of a night cap. Im full of ABV. Its super rich and sweet, which Im not a fan of truly. Its an ok Quad, but in truth Im not a big fan of the style. It hits the marks, but to me its not enjoyable more like work.

At a tasting, many thanks MrHangover, almost no head, quite clear dark brown colour, aroma of dried cherries and apricots, caramel and light oxidised notes, fruity sour flavour with woody and sherry notes, a bit too light bodied. Quite old but still interesting.
Bottle at Imbibe Wine. Nose is candisugar, dark fruits, and sweet. Clear dark brown with a medium heavy lacing beige head. Flavor is lightly sweet and fruity with hints of spices.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2014 33cl in a Trappist glass. Pours a wonderful dark brown colour with a white head. Aroma is sweet and wonderful. The taste is toffee, caramel, malt and very (ginger)bready. Too sweet and sickly for the style and extremely susceptible to temperature.
Wow, packs a punch but doesnt actually taste 11°. Great balance, sweet but dry enough to make it slip down very nicely. The best in bruge so far.
Bottle @john bull ålborg. Served too cold, but after waiting a bit a rich dark character shows. Notes of dark berries and bitter chocolate.

Pours dark brown with only a thin wispy head, which doesnt seem right. Maybe a bad seal or it got shorted on the yeast? Fantastic caramel and plum aroma hits even before lifting the glass. Taste is similar with hints of roasted coffee. Feels a bit flat. Will definitely need to sample another bottle.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2014 Bottle from Beers of Europe. Mid to dark brown, reasonably translucent. A fair bit of carbs and khaki head. Full aroma of molasses and plum pudding. The taste is sweet but manages to stay rounded. Theres a full alcoholic kick as well. Very warming on a horrid January night.

Mooi donker bruin kleurig bier. Veel CO2. Smaak zeer zoet bijna dropperig bij stroperig.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ home. Schiuma beige fine ed abbastanza persistente. Birra di colore ramato carico, ai limiti del marrone con riflessi aranciati. Velata,quasi limpida. Aroma abbastanza intenso, esteri da lievito, liquirizia, zucchero di canna, dattero, caramello. Gusto abbastanza intenso, dolce abboccato, di caramello, lieve acidità, poca sapidità. Retrolfattivo di frutta secca (noce). Abbastanza corposa, calda alcolica,poco carbonata, rotonda, equilibrata ed armonica.

Bottle, 11%. Good caramelly aroma, creamy with a distinct alcohol note. Almost clear dark brown colour. Small frothy off-white head. The flavour is sweet and alcoholic. Has a little tobacco and salt. Fruity notes in the finish. Warming alcohol, but not boozy at all.

Bottle. Pours cloudy dark brown with airy light tan head. Sweet, clear aroma of malt, caramel, fruit, and chocolate. Ditto flavour, with touches of coffee. Bitter, boozy notes. Sweetish finish. Nice. Really nice. I just love Quadrupel :-)

Bottle. Clear dark red pour with tenacious off white foam. Aroma is quite complex, rich malty notes (brown sugar, caramel), fruity, plums, molasses, blackberries, spice. Taste is sweet, quite nutty, lots of fruits (berries) with a sweet caramel finish, alcohol quite well hidden. Lingering spiciness. Palate is rich and creamy, with light prickly carbonation. Good stuff!

33cl bottle from the Beerhive.
Appearance - toffee brown with a red chink. Proportionate head. 
Nose - toffee and banana with a hint of nuts.
Taste - big toffee then a dry biscuit note which goes on. Tobacco note to follow. 
Palate - rich in body with a big opulent rich texture. Theres an oily consistency. The finish is sweet but relative to the start and middle its dry. 
Overall - lovely big nightcap beer.

Pours in dark amber almost black color body, with hints of ruby againts the light. The head is light tan, pretty big and long lasting. The aroma has caramel notes, probably from the candi sugar, hints of toast, dried plums. Taste is heavy on high alcohols, caramel sweetness with high earthy bitterness, hidden by the sweet balanced. Body is full, oily texture, low carbonation.
I was surprised by the taste as it doesnt taste like most of the quads I drink. It almost has more of a porter taste. Still very tasty though.

On tap at Tarrants on 04/12/2011. Dark brown body with ruby highlights and a medium creamy tan head. Sweet caramel, fruit, and light candi sugar aroma. Sweet caramel, molasses, fruit, and candi sugar flavor. Medium full body with moderate carbonation.

Bottle. Heavy bread, nutty and milk chocolate for the malt, moderate cooked orange for the hops, dough for the yeast, with raisin, dried cherry, wood, toffee, bourbon, with a hint of vinegar and a faint mix of baking spices. Head is small, frothy, light tan with thin slippery lacing and good legs, and is almost fully diminishing to a small ring. Color is clear burgandy. Flavor starts moderately to heavily sweet and finishes moderately to heavily sweet and lightly bitter. Palate is medium to full, syrupy with a flat to soft carbonation, and finishes lightly alcoholic. Though hugely complex its a very malty and sweet Quadrupel, its just that the sweetness isnt balanced by any acidity or enough bitterness.
Bottle->snifter. Dark brown with small offwhite head. Dark fruit, spices, sugar, caramel, malt. Nice lingering plummy aftertaste. Excellent.

Bottle split at JFs, 26/12/13.
Extremely dark mahogony brown with a good sized biege head that dissipates to pondwork,
Nose is sweet, rich caramel, dark toffee fudge, dates, raisens, booze.
Taste comprises Xmas Cake, liqourice, toffee, hint of cocoa, sweet tasting, rich caramel, nutty tang, dark fruits.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, warming alcohol in the finish.
Ok easy drinking quad but lacks a little complexity and finesse.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Color ámbar muy oscuro, media cabeza de espuma beige que desaparece rápidamente; aromas marcados a malta tostada, caramelo, frutos negros y brandy; en boca entrada maltosa y licorosa con notas a especias y alcohol bien integrado aunque sus 11º se acaban notando; cerveza con buen cuerpo amargor muy sutil y trago corto; pos gusto demasiado seco lo que la desvalora un poco.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a large off-white head that slowly but never fully disappears. Very dark and a bit reddish brown appearance. Very sweet malty aroma, hints of brown sugar, dark fruits, plum and yeast. Tasty is more yeasty, but still fruity. Hints of caramel, yeast, malts, brown sugar, plum, wood and another thing which I cant identify. Long yeasty aftertaste. Nice quad. 30 minutes later Eureka! The mystery flavor is melon. Inspired by Westy 8 maybe?

Dark brown with some reddishness. Sweet berry notes, some roasted nuttiness. Touch of bitterness, predominantly sweet. Sort of raisiny back of the mouth roundness. Mid heavy body, sort of oily.

Pours a dark brown-amber with light tan head. Aroma is a fix of fruit, spices, wheat and some yeast. Taste is similar to aroma but with stronger fruit and spices and a yeast/wheat aftertaste.
Dark beer with a beige-white head. Sweet chocolate aroma. Flavour is malty, chocolate and medium sweet. Very nice brew. (Bottle 33cl)

Pouring dark brown with a dirty white head, the aromas of fruits and a hint of spice belie the rich and enveloping flavour. Clean, complex, dry and chewy, this beer celebrates the weight of its body with a long, fruity and caramel finish. An intense beer crafted for people to appreciate as such; wowsers and wannabe-beer-lovers steer clear.

Dark brown pour with medium sized off white head. Great first smell! Raisins and other dried fruits and sweet roasted malts and burnt sugar. Wow, fantastic flavors gather in my mouth. The plummy dried fruits which I am really fond of. Not overly sweet with a nice bitter linger. Caramel and coffee/chocolate. There?s some sour in it too. Medium to full body with not too high of a carbonation and somewhat dry finish. Way better then expected. Good Quad! !

Dense dark liquid. Little dark head. Toffee, licorice, vanilla aroma, medium intensity. Strong, viscous body, alcohol is excellently masked. Finish is balanced, with a hint of coffee. Taste is intense licorice, dark fruits, sweet, very good balance.

Bottle from local liquor store. Dark brown colour, off-white head. Nose is malty, fruity, dried fruits, bit of alcohol. Flavour is malty, caramel, dark fruits, bit of spices. Medium carbonation. Finish is long, slightly boozy, fruity, malty. Good stuff.

Bottle from Voldby Købmandsgaard. Dark brown colour with a small head. Very nice taste of caramel, dark berries, toffee, some chocolate notes. Good texture. Nice creamy mouthfeel. Warm alcohol taste with a nice light bitterness in the finish. Very good beer.
From Brewery. Almost stout like quality with a little soy.. Very nice indeed . will buy again.
33 cl bottle. Dark brown color. Dried fruit, caramel, toffee and red wine aroma. Powerful taste like a caramelized Porto :)

Couleur noire et reflet rouge. Belle mousse dense et beige. Nez de fruits noirs et un peu malté. Biere epaisse, au gout de fruits noirs, sucre candy, un peu malté et note alcolisée. Bonne amertume en fin de bouche

black with ruby reflexes, small but long-lasting tanned foam; dark berries, floral, some chocolate or coffee; medium sweetness, lightly bitter, noticable alcohol; full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long dry finish;
Overall: there are better quadruples (alcohol a little bit too noticable) but still, its a very good beer

330ml bottle. pours dark, clear brown with big head and good lacing. aroma is very malty, a bit of coffee, fermented fruit (plums). nice taste. very sticky, caramel, plums again and yeasty finish. very nice.

Good quadruple. Pours a dark beer with an off-white head. Aroma: dried fruits, caramel, alcohol. Taste: sweet with a sweet and slighty bitter finish. Palate: exemplary for the style, good carbonation. Very nice quadruple.
Bomber. Reddish brown pour - rich looking. Aroma is dark fruit and dark chocolate. Just a bit of booze. All the elements are there, but not quite as standout as St. Bernardus or Rochefort.

Dark brown, beide head. Nose: caramel, alts, dried fruits, nuts, hint of alcohol, spices. Taste: chocolate, bit of caramel, alcohol. well carbonated, bitter touch in the aftertaste, strong alcoholic body, sweet, warm, very levelled out.
Une bière avec beaucoup de goût. Goût huileux que j'adore. Dommage que elle se digère difficilement. Une de mes préférées malgré tout.
Dark black slightly brown colour, small beige head, sweet cherry smell, medium to high carbonation sour taste, medium bitter, warm alcohol taste, fruity cherry taste a bit to much

Que rica coño!. Deliciosa Quadrupel Belga, muy a la altura de la Rochefort 10. Cerveza oscura y de fuerte paladar, corona bien marcada y sabor acaramelado con retrogusto intenso.
Deliciosa!!!!
Dark brown beer, white foam. Medium carbonation. Well balanced beer, full body. Aroma of dark fruit, chocolate, roasted malts and alcohol. Sweet and bitter. Nice beer.

33cl bottle. Dark brown with medium to big head. 
NOSE : burned malts with dried fruits like raisins, figs, pineapple and mango. Fresh banana and licorice. 
SIP : smooth and creamy. Low to medium carbonation. The body is thick. The body texture is spot on. It marry well with sweet, burned and fruity flavors of this beer. Sweet chocolate tart with a hint of alcohol. Dark fruits and licorice give it a little sour and dry middle. Ending is deep and malty. Some spiciness in the finish. Alcohol is amazingly well hidden. 
OVERALL : a great brew ; well balanced, smooth body and the drinkability is quite surprising for the amount of alcohol it has. Well done.
Bière brune corsée et ronde. Peu damertume, équilibrée. Très bonne pour attendre lhiver

330ml bottle into Trappist glass. Great 1.5 finger ivory head that quickly gains some interesting large bubble voids. Aroma isn't particularly notable for a quad. Taste is sweet caramel & dark stewed fruits which then smoothly gains extra layers of bitter dark chocolate & coffee beans. High 11% ABV is almost completely masked. Nice viscous mouthfeel with a nice tingle on the tongue due to the fairly high carbonation for the style. Very good quad.

A great quad. Pours a dark deep brown. Aromas of rich dark fruit. Raisin and fig. Lots of vinous and fresh grape aromas. Nice sweet malty flavors. Dark fruit and grapes. Delicious.

Caramel, toffee, bread, and dark fruit in the aroma. Flavor starts sweet and bready, with some fruit and spice. Finish is more bitter than I expected, with lots of drying alcohol and more spice flavor. Like most quadrupels, this has lots and lots of flavor--a really nice cold night sipper.

Bière brune-rougeâtre au col couleur crème assez solide. Arôme de fruits noirs, de raisins secs et de caramel. Goût de caramel et de mélasse, de fruits noirs et puis arrive le chocolat au lait, le miel et un rien dalcool. Un bière plus quagréable.
A really good dark beer, taste is strong and warming with an oily palate, superb

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2013 If you could get rich chocolate cake and a good coffee in a bottle then this would be it. I wouldnt normally go for a beer this sweet but the intense aromas and flavours of chocolate, xmas cake and coffee are extremely pleasant. Didnt find any bitterness at all unlike some reviewers. Would make a great dessert beer.

fruity nose, some dark aged fruit aroma, esters, almost bavarian wheat beer-like esters. a touch of alcohol in the nose. clear, very dark brown color with modest head. rich flavor, dark fruits, raisins, some alcohol. heavy side of medium body. actually, light side of heavy body -- almost viscous.

0.33 bottle. Black with a big, milk-colored, creamy head. Aroma of dark malts, dark forest fruits, a touch of nuts and some sour notes, marzipan and raisins as well; only small hints of alcohol are detectable despite its huge ABV.
