Finish is slightly astringent, has the sour notes previously mentioned emphasized. Overall the beer is really good but personally I am not fond of that sourness lingering in the background; could be improved.

33cl bottle into tulip. Lille. 

Appearance: very dark brown, almost black. Small tan head.

Aroma: caramel, coffee, dark fruits, chocolate alcohol. 

Taste: sweet, then a little bit of bitter. 

Palate: full body. Low carbonation (good in this case). Long finish. 

Overall. Tastes of intense coffee with a lot of sugar. Not the most complex or interesting of quads, but still excellent. Impressive flavor for 11%.

Prawie doskonale piwo. Wspanialy aromat slodowo czekoladowy, daktylowy. W smaku piernik, czekolada troche kawy i karmelu. Slodkawy posmak ale taki przyjemny z klasa smak. Finisz slodko rozgrzewajacy. Ciut alkocholowy. Ale swietnie to wszystko zgrane. Niewielka niana ale kolor czarny jak imperialny stout. Czworniak godny polecenia

Poured into a tulip glass. Two and half fingers of head on a deep brown colored body. 
The aroma is a great blend of caramel, apple, pear and other bright fruits.
The taste has a big dose of caramel malt sweetness, some fruit, black licorice and mild bitter finish.
The texture is fairly smooth with moderate carbonation.
Very well done..

Pours a deep brown color with a large tan head that fades slowly to ample lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, fruit, bit of nut with just a hint of alcohol. The taste is of Roasted malt, fruit, some nut and trace of chocolate as it warms. Has a subtle bitterness and a dry finish. Moderate body, smooth, almost velvety, clean with a richness throughout. As it warms it enhances to character. Great beer to end the day with, an easy sipper that is well worth checking out

Dark ruby brown with off-white foam head. Aroma is promising a warm tasty beer. Nice malt taste, some nutty tones, warm alcohol. A good quadruple. (Velp 201310)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark cognac colored brown with a large lasting tan head, light lacing. Aroma has caramel malt, yeast with dark fruit esters and some raisins and black figs. Taste same as aroma with some mild hops bitterness to mellow out the sweetness and sweet alcohol notes. Palate is a full , creamy, slightly thick and sticky mouth feel, good carbonation. Finish has very rich flavor,same attributes as taste with some brown sugar and a lingering caramel malt and sweet alcohol flavors. Alcohol seems well hidden but you feel it in the end. Overall a very good, delicious and flavorful brew.
UPDATED: JUN 5, 2015 Pours a deep dark amber/brown with a slight beige head. Potent aroma of dark fruits, chocolate toffee, caramel, brown sugar, coffee. Very nice quadrupel.

Pours cola-colored with thin fizzy head that isnt there for long. Extremely malty aroma with lots of caramel and dried fruit notes. Flavor is similar, and manages to be sweet and rich but not cloying. Exceptionally smooth for its heft. Good thing its a small bottle...

Bottle. Pours hazy/murky amber-brown with a somewhat lacing and diminishing beige creamy big head. Aroma is bread, marzipan, raisin, nuts, caramel, bubblegum, hops, anise and brown sugar.
Taste is moderate sweet and light+ bitter. Body is near full, texture is creamy, carbonation is high. Finishes balanced with lingering caramel and a alcoholic burn. More restrained than your typical quad.

Pours very dark mahogany with a large fizzy beige head. Smells strongly of dark fruits with subtle candy sweetness. Taste is sweet, fruity, and hints of caramel. Full-bodied with a smooth texture and fizzy mouth-carbonation, Straffe Hendrik Brugs Quadrupel finishes with a slight tingle of alcohol warmth.

Flaska från SB. Ca 1 år gammal. Mahognyfärgad, klar vätska med högt, tjockt och bestående skum. Snyggt. Alkoholburna dofter av torkad frukt, söt tobak, belgisk jäst. Kraftig smak med värmande alkohol, söt, marsipan, torkad frukt, sherry, madeira, tobak, fuktigt trä, rejäl efterbeska. Riktigt trevlig.

Bottle @ bierhuyske 
Pours very dark
No foam at all 
Very chocolaty smell 
Taste is sweet , chocolate , malts , low cqrbo , earthyness ,.. 

Hell yes , this beats the shit out of the tripel version !
Sample at DØE 2013. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of malt, spice, alcohol, fruit, yeast and caramel.

Draft. Poured dark reddish brown with a huge head. Aroma of dark malts and cherry, maybe some other dark fruits as well. Taste adds a bit of chocolate. Light airy palate is unique and enjoyable but based on that and the head I do wonder if it was intended to be that way. All in all very nice and surprisingly drinkable for a quad.
Plum, grapefruit with coffee, dark chocolate finish. Nice but more one-dimensional than e.g. Rochefort 10.
Een straffe hendrik quadruppel uit de fles in een rochefort glas. wat een topbier, niet te koel drinken.

33cl. Pours dark red, almost black with moderate mostly persisting head. Sweet, moderate malty, caramel,alchool aroma. Flavor is sweet malt, alchool, light bitter, well balanced. Light for the 11%, but good.
Shared a 33cl bottle from Delheize. Pours a brown colour with a tan persistent head. Aroma is caramel and yeast. Medium carbonation and full body. Flavour is quite light for a 11 ABV beer. Good!

Tap. Pours a dark red-brown with a large resilient off-white head taste is of roasted malts, caramel, sugar, dark fruits, spices and a bit of yeast. Sweet with some hoppiness in the finish. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from the National Brewery Centre, Burton. Dark reddish brown with a small head. Aroma of dark fruits and caramel. Taste is dark fruits, caramel, sweet malts and alcohol. Medium bodied and chewy. A very nice beer.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
A well rounded and restrained quad offering initially distinct components which merge to create an enjoyably sweet and earthy ale from start to finish

A very deep mahogany body supports a 1", desaturated khaki head which falls to a thick, solid ring and thin continent producing thick yet fleeting, arcing peninsulas of lace
-
Smooth, well controlled candied sugars lead the way, introducing raisins, blueberries, figs, and prunes complimented by lighter, juicy sweet notes of apple and pear, married by dark caramel and molasses nuances, all rounded by a light finishing layer of milk chocolate on a smooth, medium body with restrained carbonation for the style, leaving a light, silky, sugary coating; residuals are a blended sense of the aromas and flavors with a building influence of clove and fruity ester finishing with a flair of alcohol warmth collaborating to communicate a sense of raw honey; I generally experience fall leaves and thanksgiving desserts, warm and sweet, but with a humble earthy character

11.2 oz notched best before bottle code L: c D 13 (which must be sometime in December of 2013) at 50º into 16oz Sade brandy snifter
Bottle from Ashley. Brownish pour with a beige head. Aroma is plums, carbonation, alcohol, and brown sugar. Taste is brown sugar, alcohol, crazy dark fruit, and yeast.

33cl bottle.
APPEARANCE: dark brown beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: caramel, sweet, burned malts, little anise.
TASTE: lots of alcohol, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, burned malts, molasses.
Very decent beer!

How: Draught.
Where: De Republiek, Brugge.
Appearance: Dark red colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Caramel, spices, alcohol, malt, dark fruit.
Body: Watery body with rather low carbonation.
Flavour: Caramel, spices, alcohol, dark fruit.
Comment: Starts off good, but falls flat at the end. Would have been much better if it managed to last all the way through the sip, as it is it falls a bit short.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks beerandbeyond. Dark brown color. Aroma of alcohol, malt, caramel and lots of dark fruits (prunes, plums and raisins). Sweet malty flavor with caramel, demerara sugar, a bit of molasses and lots of dark fruits. Medium-bodied, a bit heavy.

beige head, disappears fast, some lacing. dark-brown clear colour. aroma is boozy, dark fruit, raisins, esters, chocolate and spices. taste is boozy, spices, raisin, wood, candysugar with aftertaste of bitter chocolate, liquorice and vanilla. quite dense mouthfeel, soft carbonation, alcoholsweetness. much better than i expected. bottle 33 cl / lot B / best before jan-2016

Poured a huge super tight foamy super light beige head over a super deep amber/brown body. Aroma is sweet, sugar, dark fruit, plums, prunes, raisins, dates, alcohol, dough, yeast, rotting banana, bubble gum, chocolate, bready. Flavor is solid, raisin, dates, chocolate, yeast, nutts, rotting bananas, bubble gum, slight slight alcohol. Palate was full, syrupy, and lighter carbonation. Great stuff.
Clear dark brown appearance, medium strong head. Inviting dark fruits and roasted malt aroma. Sweet with gentle bitter finish. Good beer.
Bottle from Fratto. Pours a dark caramel color with a thin light tan head. I can definitely smell the 11%. The taste is not overpowering at all, slightly sour.
Brownishred pour with an offwhite head. Taste is malts, caramel, sugar, dark fruit, bit of bitter and spices. Good brew.

Poured from a corked bottle in a Great Lakes tulip glass.
Big pop of cork...pours a dark brown with big amber head.
Aroma of dark malts, alcohol, and malt sweetness.
Moderate carbonation and mouthfeel.
Flavors of dark roasted malts, alcohol, caramel, molasses, dark chocolate, milk chocolate. Overall big and bold with a big alcohol strength coming through over the big malt body. After 10 minutes the alcohol resides a good amount.

Murky dark brown color, tan head. Hoppy aroma with a hint of alcohol. Warming flavor with hops, juicy malts, dark chocolate, lavender, vanilla and plum. Wow. Full body, high carbonation. Very nice.

De Straffe Hendrik Quadrupel was enige tijd geleden en ware verrijking, als trouwe aanhanger van ondernemer de La Trappe Quadrupel. Het aroma is vol en donker met geuren van karamel, candij en donker fruit. De hop toets volgt subtiel op het einde en de geur van de gist blijft in het aroma goed verborgen. Aan het uiterlijk merk je vooral aan de fijn bruisende schuimkraag en vooral de kleine explosies hierin dat je met een bier van zeer hoge gisting te maken hebt. De kleur van het bier zelf is donker bruin en vrijwel ondoorzichtig.
De smaak ligt in het verlengde van het aroma. Toetsen van gebrande candij, bitterheid van licht gezoete koffie mn met in de afdronk een lichte fruitige toets. Vooral in de smaak is het vleugje banaan, afkomstig van de gist prominent aanwezig.
Het mondgevoel is heerlijk, licht bruisend en sprankelend, doch klef genoeg om de nasmaak voldoende vast te houden.
Voor mij dus al bij al een heel goed bier wat ik op en eerder winterse- of herfstavond, onder de gezelligheid van het haardvuur aan mijn gasten zou durven serveren. Top!

Bottle Pours a very dark brown color with a thin tan head on it. Nose is dark and fruity with some elements of raisins and figs in there, as well as some candied sugar. Taste is dark and subtly sweet, with just a hint of some roasting in there at the end. A very interesting quad.
Brune très foncée, pétillance faible, quasi pas de mousse. Malts rôtis et caramélisés, présence dorange et de fruits foncés, belles notes de chocolat. Alcool un peu trop présent.
Bottle at bar. Dark brown color, beige head. Bitter taste with citrus, ripe fruits, earthy notes, nuts and plum. Bittersweet finish with ripe fruits and citrus. Excellent quadruppel.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2016 0,33l fles @ hof van Medemblik, mooi diepbruine ebbenhout kleur. Met dik romig schuim, dat redelijk blijft staan. In de geur gebrande mout, bruine suiker en gist. Smaak is vol met een minimaal bittertje in de afdronk. Mooi vol boeket aan rijp fruitsmaken. Doet denken aan kersen en pruimen. Wel erg alcoholisch

Dark amber/brown pour with a small off-white head. Aromas of dark fruit, brown sugar, and yeast notes. Lots of malt on the palate with plum and almost a port like finish to it, the brown sugar character also shines through in the finish. The abv is well-hidden too. Delicious.

33 cl. bb Aug. 2016. Deep mahogany with a ring and smattering of bubbles. Aroma is chocolate toffee, dark grapes, dates, marshmallow and plum. Taste is cocoa, merlot, white pepper, clove, caramel, prunes and plum. Lightly toasted oak plus touches of cured tobacco and soy on the long finish. Medium-heavy body strikes a delicate balance and shows a gentle touch of abv warmth. Also has a higher level of carbonation than I like, but it seems likely the flare-ups in the mouth help to ease the richness of this brew more than they detract.
Bottle shared. Pours amber slight Brown. Taste is full of sweet fruit, with Malts and hints of chocolate. Good beer

330 ml bottle. L B. BB D/13. From Belgium. Courtesy of Brandman.
Dark brown colour with a small greyish white head. 
Surprisingly sweet malty aroma with some tartness, alcohol and saltiness. 
The flavour is salty soy sauce, dark fruits, cola, malt, some sweetness, mild yeast and a bit of hops. Not very complex nor interesting. Some alcohol there too.
Brown body, bit grey and white head. Aroma raisins sweet chocolate and cola malt. Alcohol and port wine like flavours. Fruits and alcohol.
Dark brown, smoky, musty , peat, chocolate, molasses, dried fruit. Complex and the character changes as it warms. This is a nice sipper to relax and enjoy.

Surprenant, les aromes herbacées de poivre qui séchappent du vers dès le départ. Avec lambiance tempérée, elle perd ces caractéristiques pour laisser plus de place au malt, fruits confits (mûres / canneberges) et épices de noel. 
Son apparence physique na rien dextraordinaire, cest bel et bien une brune belge.
En bouche par contre, explosion de saveurs plus riche les unes qur les autres: un bouquet complexe et arômatique, fidèle aux impressions que son nez laisse présager. Effervecente dabord, son corps velouté ressort avec la température grimpante du liquide à lair ambiant. Délectable.
Bottle at Mikeys event. Pours a dark amber/brown color with a medium beige head. A big nutty and berries nose. Some heat, toffee, caramel, strawberries, a bit of tobacco. Nice.

Bottle shared by someone at Mikeys summer party 
Clear copper with a lot of floaters, medium beige head and good lacing. Aroma of toasted malts and sweet caramel. Flavors of toasted malts, sweet, woody and toffee 
Nice

33cl bottle from bier tempel, brussels. Dark color with red bottom, medium white head. Medium bitterness and low sweetness. Medium to low carbonation. Aroma is alcohol, caramel, raisins, light herb, metal and wood. Aroma could be better but still overall this is nice!
Pours dark clear brown with two fingers of off white head. Smells of caramel and malts. Tastes of caramel, malts, and metal. Slight alcohol. Short flavor with light carbonation.

Dark, rich, chewey. Taste of raisins, burnt sugars and yeast. Very good quad that is as good or better than its rating. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mooie donkere kleur. Ruikt, chocolade, caramel, koffie. Smaakt lekker zwaar met goede afdronk.
Pours a beautiful black beer with a good white head. Smells like red wine and sweet. Pretty nice. Taste is quite nice. A bit licorice and chocolate. The palate is perfect with this one.

Bottle @ home aged probably 18 months since purchasing in Colorado. Not sure I ever had Straffe Hendrik while in Bruges but excited to have it now. Pours a somewhat murky brownish appearance with a thin but decent light brown head. Quite rich woody/bourbon-esque, spicy, dark chocolate, herbal, moderately dark fruity aroma that is very interesting. Chewy yeasty, tangy, big raisin, plum, blueberry, toffee, chocolate, rich candy sugar flavor. Fun to drink. Would buy again.
Tap at chp beer festival, 25 / 5 2013. Clear dark brown, small head. Aroma off raisins, plums, wine. Taste like plums, raisins, some sweetness, bread,  wine, yeast. Spicy bitter finish
Poured amber/dark color with a white head. Aromas of dark fruit, brown sugar, yeast and caramel. Very nice ale.

Head: beige, medium, frothy, avg. retention. Colour: deep amber-brown, almost black. 

Aroma: tropical fruit, grapes, fresh and minty hops and a fair amount of sharp vodka-like alcohol. Taste: rather sweet, licorice, rather bitter and spicy with a quite brutal alcoholic note.
Red-brown color. Foam vanished quickly. First sip brings a smile on my face. Warming and delicious. Slightly sweet and tastes of ripe plums and raisins.
Bottle. Dark brown. Caramel, yeasty belgian esters. Body is medium full, a bit of roasted malts. Dark fruits, belgian yeast. Ok, but not as soft as expected.-- bb/h(n9)

Bottled. Clear dark ruby brown color, big lasting brown head. Aroma of caramel malt, loads of special B, raisin. Slight metallic, spicy belgian yeast. Quite malty taste, medium sweet, dry, drying alcohol. Burns a bit. Too alcoholic basicly.
Better for cold, winter weather. Raisin or fig aroma and flavors, sweet notes. Heavy but smooth.

In short: An Belgian Abt (fruity, etc.) that is more roasted than usual. Good.
How: Bottle 330ml.  Consumed approximately 6 months after purchase.
The look: Cloudy dark mahogany body topped by a medium fizzy dark-beige head quickly dissipating to a persistent layer of foam leaving lots of lacings on the glass.
In long: Nose is estery, raisin pie, overcooked dark fruits, burnt pasty.  Taste is burnt crusty raisin pie, crunchy roasted grains, Fig Newton cookies, a peppery spiciness, overcooked caramel, dehydrated prunes, black pepper spiciness, trappist-style yeast sensation.  No alcohol presence whatsoever which was nice.  Relatively low sweetness sensation for its style and size.  Generous carbonation, maybe a little too generous considering the body wasnt as full and rich as a 11% quad should be.  The beer has many characteristics of a typical abbey Quad except that it is more roasted, it felt as roasted as many roasted imperial stouts Ive had.  A good beer but just average for the style, although I was told more recent batches have improved, will eventually try again. And I just try to express my honest opinions here despite those people who say Im just an hypocrite who lies all the time, and I have the outmost respect for these people and wish them all the best.

750 ml bottle into chalice, no bottle dating.  Pours fairly crystal clear very dark reddish brown color with a nice 2 finger dense and fluffy khaki head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts.  Nice thick soapy lacing clings on the glass, with plenty of streaming carbonation.  Aromas of big raisin, prune, apple, caramel, toast, toffee, molasses, pepper, light clove, cocoa, light roast, and yeast earthiness.  Damn nice aromas with great complexity and balance of malt and fruity/spicy ester notes.  Taste of raisin, prune, apple, molasses, caramel, toast, toffee, cocoa, pepper, light clove, light roast, and yeast earthiness.  Lingering notes of dark fruit, molasses, caramel, toast, toffee, cocoa, light roast, pepper, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while.  Incredible flavor balance and complexity of dark malt and fruity/spicy yeast esters; with zero cloying flavors after the finish.  Medium-high carbonation and fairly full bodied; with a creamy, slick, and lightly prickly mouthfeel that is fantastic.  Alcohol is extremely well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is an absolutely incredible Quadrupel!  Incredible balance and complexity of flavors; and very smooth to sip on.  A totally world class offering.
Very full and nice fermented, rich in flavor - orange, caramel, southern fruits. Very, very fruitful with nice roast bi-taste. Quality beer.

Reddish-brown pour with a beige head. Boozy aromas of raisins, chocolate and sweet spice. Rich flavours of licorice, toffee, chocolate and sweet spice. Quite a throat warmer. Good, long roasty finish. Nice.
October 2011. From a 750 ml. corked bottle. Poured amber color with a white head. Aromas of dark fruit, brown sugar, yeast and caramel. Very nice ale.
Bottled, dark amber color with no head, lots off raisin and fruit cake , apple pecan flavors, softer finish reminds of some dopples, nice smooth warm finish

Almost black pour with massive rocky head. Raisins and sweet juicy fruit aromas. Sweet, fruity caramel notes with some noble hops creeping in and a metalic twinge in the finish. Chewy and lightly carbonated.

Ruddy brown/copper colored beer with a frothy, off-white head. Aromas of booze, something sweet, and dough. Tastes of candy sugar, earthy/leathery flavors, some prunes, and sweet dough. Some funky nutty flavors are mixed in as well. Very complex. Cloying sweetness on the finish complimented by a lasting alcohol burn. Strong stuff, definitely a sipper. I enjoyed it.

From a 12 oz bottle shared in Avon .  Pours a dark opaque brown with a creamy off white head.  Aroma of caramel and raisins which also dominate the flavor.  Notes of dark cherry round out this flavorful quad.
33cl bottle. Clear dark ruby with a nice creamy head. Vanilla, fruits and some spices. A very strong and tasty beer.

From a 330 ml bottle, deep red pour with a small foamy head, decent carbonation, in the aroma cherries, berries, candy sugar, pistachio nuts, Finish is quite short its sweet in the mouth but the finish is smooth and well balanced. Hides the 11% abv well. Top quality.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2013 33cl, BB 11/2015. - Pours an unctuous dark brown/purple with solid off-white head. Aroma is is an aromatic and port-like syrup of sweet dark fruits. Taste is immensely layered as you would expect of a quadruple, ranging from intital malt and dark fruit sweetness with heavy alcohol to coffee roast dryness and pronounced hop spice shifting to take centre stage as it warms. Strange effervescence for a beer this heavy. Depending on your drinking needs of the evening, you could dub this mix willfully complex or dramatically confused. What remains is a unique and artfully crafted mahogani master of a quad.

Dark, really good beer.  Creamy head.  Slight after taste or would be perfect. I bought at random in a Liege Belgium grocery along with three others.  This was definitely the best of the group.  Not as sweet as Rochefort 10 (my favorite other than Westvleteren 12) but good enough that I will definitely recommend and buy again.

11.2 oz bottle pours deep amber with a off white head.  Aroma is sweet fruit, chocolate and malts.  Taste Is the fruit and a slight bitter finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep clear mahogany orange body with a large tan colored head. Pungent sweet vanilla, dried light fruits and christmas spices on the nose. Smooth, full bodied and alcoholic. Pungent sweet and bitter with toasted notes and spicy roasted hints. Dry tongue. Even warms the throat.

330 ml bottle, from Voldby Købmandsgård, Denmark. ABV is 11%. Very dark brown to ruby colour, large beige head. Nicy spicy and intensely malty aroma, also notes of brown sugar, dark dried fruits and oak. Rich and warming mouthfeel. The flavour is sweet with distinct notes of spices, oak, malts and molasses, also dark dried fruits again. Pretty impressive stuff.
Pours dark with a rapidly dissipating tan head. Aroma is malty, licorice. Taste is malts, licorice, stone fruits. Warming full bodied, lively carbonation, dry malty finish.

Very dark brown Belgian barley wine with a lot of fig in the nose, a firm clean bitterness, off-dry, warmth in the belly but not on the tongue. Best by says 2015; I dont know its age but there is an oxidized sherry note that the ale handles with grace. Otherwise its a bit clean and ought to have more flavor for its strength.

2013.03.28 - Straffe Hendrik Brugs Quadrupel - 750ml bottle in pint glass. Label marked 21-11-2014.

Aroma is candy sugar, plum and fig type fruit, some bready yeast.  Sill, an atypical Belgian aroma in my experience.

Appearance: Pours around 18 on the SRM scale, a beautiful rich clear brown. Light tan head is quite active, almost.perfect in carbonation and size, sticky.

Taste:  I agree with reviewer below "Subtle alcohol taste which brings a nice body to the beer. Then you can savour vanilla and caramel flavours and a little hint of a sweet and pleasant red fruit, perhaps raspberry".   I dont know how to describe it, a really nice balance of sweet, tart, and alcohol warmth.  Perhaps a bit heavy on alcohol burn, but its an exceptional taste.

Palate: Mostly light despite being an 11% abv, moderately high carbonation.

A really nice beer, repeat purchase worthy for sure.

Large tan head dark mauve brown pour soft carbonation aromasport caramel figs yeast dried fruit plum the flavours sweet figs cherries port plums yeast rich tasting caramel lovely mixes of fruit a bitter taste a lovely finish best aftertastes strong fruit sharp dried dark sweet flavours yeast and malt backing lovely quad

Colore mogano, con schiuma compatta e persistente. Aroma di malti tostati, caramello, vaniglia, con note fruttate. Nel palato entra morbida, con sentori di malto, zucchero candito e frutta secca. Alcol mascherato.

How to open the bottle: 1) Carefully remove the metal cage, 2) Let the pressure dislodge the cork. (You may have to retrieve the cat, though.) Comes out a nice clear warm sepia with a thick light buff head. Inviting aroma tempts with brown sugar, apple, roast malt and subtle caramel notes. Sublime flavor fills the palate with malty, fruity, earthy, nutty and molasses notes plus hints of caramel. Smooth, lively texture leaves nutty, earthy and fruity notes on a very happy tongue.

Draft. Cloudy brown, lasting light tan head. Nose is big dark fruits, plums, raisins, brown sugar. Taste is lightly chocolate covered raisins, rich nuts, dark fruits. Not boozy like i expected. Smooth silky mouthfeel.

Subtle alcohol taste which brings a nice body to the beer. Then you can savour vanilla and caramel flavours and a little hint of a sweet and pleasant red fruit, perhaps raspberry. They used to call beer  "liquid bread", well Id like to call this beer "liquid "forêt noire" cake". A gourmet and unctuous beer. Magnificent.

I can smell it already and ive only started pouring it, sweet malt and dark fruits aroma, pours dark brown with a lightly tanned head. Quite smooth on the palate with flavours of dark fruit, caramel and brown sugar. So well balanced, would not have guessed an eleven percenter. What an awesome Quadrupel!

Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur cola, mousse assez faible et de faible tenue. Les arômes sont par contre tout à fait intense avec du pruneau et autres fruits secs, de la frangipane, de la noisette, du caramel et une pointe de café sucré. Tout celà est très harmonieux et bien que très sucré, pas du tout écoeurant. La carbonnation est moelleuse, bien quun peu faible. Trouvée à lEntrepôt - Courcelles les Lens.

March 13, 2013 - bottle from Randalls.  Dark brown pour with big head that lasted and lacing.  Aroma was dark fruit, yeast, spice and sweet malt.  Wow super sweet sugary start, then gets spicy, moves into the dark fruit and finishes with some dry alcohol.  This is not subtle, the flavors are in your face.

Bottle. Lovely auburn colour with a low light brown head, no lace. Aroma is spicy and yeasty and sweet, leading into a palate filled with chewy sweet brown sugar, dried figs, dried apricots, sultanas, and hints of dark cherries and tea. Very complex, warming without being harsh. One of the most enjoyable quads Ive had in a while.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
# 3225
ersma: quadrupel bedeutet ja nicht, dass vier mal mehr malz im sud ist - das wäre mehr so ein gerstenbrei, nicht umrührbar bis staubig. aber was quadrupel genau bedeutet oder definiert, ist auch nicht richtig klar.
schwarz wie die nacht mit feincremigem schaum, der sehr stabil ist. erstaunlich für 11 volt.
der geruch ist süßlich bis süß, aromen von karamell und trockenbeeren.
der antrunk ist perlig, süßlich mit aromen von beeren, karamell, blumenwiese, honig. die mitte bleibt karamellbetont, dazu trockenpflaume und etwas hopfen, der zum abgang deutlicher wird, dem malzigen fundament aber den vortritt lässt. dazu getreide und vanille.
die flasche ist ansehnlich.
fazit: überzeugendes quadrupel mit sehr komplexer aromenvielfalt und toller optik. unbedingt probierenswert.
14,13,12,12,11,12		-	12,30		-	5/3
nice big head, chocolate colour and light chocolate aroma. pleasant oily palate, bitter sweet taste reminding of nuts & dark chocolate. medium long bitterish finish.

In straffe glass 2 finger bubbly head thats off white. Fades slowly with nice lacing
Lots of raisins in this. Semi plum noted and acorns. Caramel as well
Taste is semi boozy at the finish. Sweet apricots and plums with raisins and a super sweet taste throughout. Very boozy but the sweetness balances that out

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2016 Bottle from Mam and Dads holiday, Belgium. A very dark brown-black beer with a rich malty and chocolate flavour, spicy red fruity and currant notes, followed by a sweet, wamring creamy oak and vanilla finish. Very good.

Bottle. Pours a deep dark brown with a dense tan head. Rich malty nose with caramel, belgian yeast, raisins, and fruity esters. Flavor was very sweet with caramel, dried dark fruit, raisins, and had a touch of toffee.   A decent quad
Beautiful uneven white head on an almost dark beer. Aroma of bread and molasses, beautiful sticky palate and again that wheat bread and molasses flavor. Beautiful beer.

Bottle (750 ml). Thanks to Jean-François L. Dark brown with a medium fully lasting beige head and some lacing. Aroma of belgian yeast, malt/caramel and dark fruits. Taste is moderately sweet and yeasty with spices, malt/caramel and dark fruits. Medium carbonation that tickle the tongue. Alcohol is really well hidden. Very good Quadruple. Well balanced and very complex. I really liked this one!

Pours dark brown with bubbly tan head. Sweet grainy aroma full of fruits. The flavor is great rounded Belgian dark malts that match the rich rounded candied fruits with a toffee and light chocolate note. Its a bit crazy but still really easy to drink and write tasty.

Pours dark brown with large gassy tan head. Aroma of a well liquored fruitcake. Taste is a three way battle between malt, dark fruit and alcohol. What make this beer so interesting is that this battle ends in a three-way tie.
Love it!

poured dark brown with an amber tint, big head and some lacing. Rich, dried fruit and bready aroma. Taste is not as nice as the aroma with alcohol and a bit astringent. It has quite a kick and not so well balanced. Uneven finish, a subpar quad.

Bottle at sampling session. From notes. Prunes, candi sugar, and some grassiness in the nose.  Very cola-like. Mid palate is a bit harsh and unrefined. Has quite a kick. Drinkable, indeed. But not the best of quads.

Bottle from Beer Merchants. Snow day beer. The pours deep brown with a large off-white head. The nose is very sweet candied orange peel, golden raisins, bubblegum. Sweet chocolate milk. Cherry and strawberry jam. Mild spices. Cotton candy. The taste is candied prunes. Other sweet, dark fruits. Some plums, bruised over-ripe bananas. cotton candy. Earthy licorice and tree bark. Light booze on the long, full finish. Full body, plenty of carbonation. Overall, a decent quad. Nothing more.
Bottle. Red amber colour with a beige head. Aroma is alcohol, sugar, dried fruits, anise, roasted malt. Flavour is alcohol,  sugar, dried fruits, anise, roasted malt, cara,el. full body. Nice beer.

Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is rather sweet with some malt, dark fruits and alcohol. Taste is malts with a nice fruitiness and some bitterness in the finish. Lingering alcoholic aftertaste.

Pours a deep umber dark mahogany color with a big frothy eggshell foam. On the nose there is a big dose of cola, caramel and a touch of boozy figs. The palate is rich chewy and full of balanced flavors that match the nose nicely. Solid quad !

Pours a small light brown frothy head that mostly diminishes. Body is dark red brown. Aroma contains molasses, forest fruits, malts, dough, licorice, raisin, plum, brown sugar, alcohol. Flavor starts off sweet and light bitter, to finish bitter and astringent, a bit dry with some alcohol. Light acidity is noticeable all the way. Body is medium, texture creamy and carbonation is soft. There is not much development in flavors but there is a lot of aroma's and the overall taste is just great. Love it!

Bottle. Dark mahogony beer with a big dark cream head. Toffee and light yeast aroma with light dark fruits. Toffee and light caramel flavor with light spice and light yeast. Medium bodied. Toffee and light yeast lingers with light spice.

Classic quad profile. Aromas and flavors of dark fruit, prune, caramelized stonefruit, banana, molasses, cola, spices and Belgium yeast. Smooth, medium-medium-plus body, with fine carbonation and a touch of bitterness in the relatively sweet/semi-dry finish.. Alcohol is very well integrated. Well balanced. Elegant, lingering nuances of cola, spice and Belgium yeast. Solid, though not my absolute favorite.  Overall, I guess I prefer a little more concentration in my quad. This was elegant throughout, which I'm sure will make many people happy. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

UPDATED: APR 17, 2015 33cl bottle grabbed in Tucson that is "best before Feb 2015." Fairly standard looking quadrupel pour with a decent head that recedes with nice lacing. Aroma is classic quad with dark fruit, caramel and molasses. True to form taste that follows the aroma but maybe a touch too much naked alcohol in the lingering finish. Good, pretty true to style.

Bottle. Dark chocolate pour with a thick mid-tan head. Nose is out of this world; some dark berries, cherry and blackcurrant, some toffee and treacle, caramel and raisins. Freshly spun sugar. I could plop my nose in the glass all day, but Im desperate to see if it lives up to it in the taste... wham! It does, sort of - quite a thick drink, and those dark berries give it a sort of vinous quality but that 11% ABV makes itself know quite early on. A mild alcohol burn and a whack of alcohol tastes somewhat overpowers this and takes away from the malty warm profile it would otherwise have. I think this could benefit greatly from ageing. Delicious, if a little overbearing.

Bottle.  Pours mostly clear dark brown with a large, creamy and frothy light tan head, long retention with excellent lacing.  Aroma is dark fruity esters (dates, plums, figs), earthy and woody hops, caramel and cookie malt, and lightly toasted grains.  Flavor is malt dominant with dark fruity esters, cellar and wood notes, light hops and bitterness with spicy and peppery alcohol.  Full body and medium carbonation, accentuated by the alcohol bite.
The best beer Ive ever tasted. So rich and complex, with bitterness and sweetness combined so expertly. Gave me goosebumps!

Brown bottle of 330 ml. ABV is 11%. Refermented in the bottle. Poured in a tulip glass.

Colour i very dark brown. Huge head of somrthing more than 3 fingers, with creamy texture, beige in colour and excellent retention.Quite a lace left behind.
Light caramel on the aroma, some roasted malts, fruits and alcohol.
Great taste, roasted malts and coffee, with a long slighty bitter finish. Alcohol so very well hidden.
A full body and average carbonation.
Overall a great quad.
Fruity sweet aroma, bready malts. Beautiful dark reddish brown body with foamy off-white head. Sweet malty taste, a touch of bitterness. Abv well masked. Very good quadrupel.

Serving: 11.2 oz. bottle at Fire Works Leesburg.  It pours a hazy brown color with a dense, light tan head.  the nose is slightly spicy with light Belgian yeast notes, and a hint of banana.  The flavor takes a mellow malt route with some dried fruit, dusty yeast notes, dried banana, and light bubble gum.  Medium bodied with high carbonation and a slightly dry finish thanks to the high ABV.  A solid quad.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2012 bruin zwart na inschenken, mooie goede volle wit/bruine schuimkraag, die echter wel redelijk snel slinkt. maar niettenin, de eerste punten zijn al binnen. 
Inmiddels ruikt de kamer al sterk naar het aroma van hout, koffie, chocolade, mout, caramel en fruit. Weer extra punten erbij. 
smaak: en daar worden punten op verloren, jammer: medium zwaar bitter, gebrand mout(caramel) zeer hoppig, koriander. overriujp fruit
volle body, volmoutig
afdronk redelijk bitter, droog.
totaan de aroma goed, daarna wordt het snel minder, helaas
UPDATED: NOV 2, 2013 Drop, zoethout, siroop, gebrande kouten. Zoet met duidelijke alcohol. Levendig koolzuur. Bruin bier met bezinksel.

33cl. Bottle. 
Poors dark ruby red, with tan head. 
Aroma dark fruits, caramel, sweet, malts. 
Taste fruity sweet, some alcohol, roasted, bitter. 
Mouth-feel creamy, thin. 
Complex quadrupel maybe not the best but really good.

Bottle shared by jayhawk73. Thanks Jeff!

The beer appears a dark maple brown color with a thick, dense, light beige head. Excellent retention and ample lacing. Quads are just great looking beers.

The aroma brings dark fruits, particularly plums, figs, raisins. Yeast presence is there as well. The aroma is a bit weak for the style.

Sweet raisins with a hint of yeast. Lingering bitterness in the finish. Caramel malt and toffee. 

Alcohol presence is very well disguised. A bit of warmth going down. Nice feel.

A good sipper. Not as complex as the Trappist examples of the style. Still, an enjoyable beer and worth a try.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-10-2011

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Mitra. Deep dark brown with a dense creamy beige head. Malty spicy caramel aroma with some red en black fruits. Tasting adds some coffee and roasted malts to it. Great full flavour, almost too sweet but just within the (my) boundaries. long aftertaste with some alcoholwarmth but the alcohol is very well concealed. Belgium has many great beers and this is certainly one of them,

33cl bottle, Delhaize. Pours clear dark brown almost black. Minimal head. Served it too cold. Sweet syrupy and perfumed nose, minimal burnt aromas, strong esters and alcohol flavor. Very much a sipper, palate is harsh, and moreso when warming up. This one is for the chain smoker I believe.
Very malty heavy aroma, quite sweet with a lot of fruit. The flavor follows with a nice warming and a peppery feel. Well balanced with a long lasting after taste.

330 ml bottle @ Beer OClock, Bucharest.

Dark brown liquid with a long creamy beige head.

Aroma is very sweet, with notes of bitter cherries, brown sugar, raisins, dried plums, baked apples, honey, noble alcohol.

Full body, bitter taste, well balanced carbonation, dry and long  finish.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2016 Tartós hab, sürü sör, melyről már a kiöntésekor érződik az extrém alkoholfok, ami az ízét is dominálja, édeskéssé teszi. Majdnem maximum, bár ebben kicsit benne van a hely varázsa is (a helyszínen, Brugge-ben, a sörfőzdében kóstolva).
Bottle shared with Mctapps. Quality beer with mixed aromas. Easy to drink but full bodied. Not a beer for everyday but well done at all.

Aroma intenso, complejo, elegante, completo. Destacan notas a maltas tostadas, caramelo, frutas y algo de madera.

En cuanto al aspecto, color obscuro con ligeros destellos rubí a contra luz. Cuerpo medio, carbonatación de ligera a media. Corona de espuma muy abundante y esponjosa al momento de servir, de mediana retención quedando finalmente una capa de espuma hasta el último trago, a pesar de no ser tan amplia como lo es al momento de servirla.

En boca destacan los sabores vinosos, ligeramente maltas tostadas y notas dulces en virtud de su refermentación en botella.

Al paladar se nota en primera instancia un agradable escozor en lengua proveniente de su carbonatación. Posteriormente sus notas vinosas y potencia alcohólica sorprenden, notandose rápidamente un aumento en el calor corporal. Su dulce final y excelente equilibrio dejan sensaciones placenteras al beber esta genial cerveza.

Como final podemos señalar que se ha bebido una excelente cerveza estilo Quadrupel. Sabores y aromas complejos, bouquet genial, y un final completo y elegante. su potencia alchólica es evidente ya que hablamos de una cerveza de 11%. Definitivamente sabosa y única.
Draft at Huppel.  Pours brown with a small tan head.  Aroma of sweet malt, burnt sugar, dark fruit, licorice and raisins.  Flavour is heavy sweet and light bitter.  Full bodied with soft carbonation.
Lekker stevig bier! Lijkt op Gulden draak qaudruppel! Warm moutig stevige alchol afdronk!

Bottle. Pours dark brown full tan head. Very malty aroma, caramel, licorice, dark fruit. Heavy sweet flavor. Fully body, texture oily, lively carbonation, mild bitter finish with subdued alcohol taste. Overall an enjoyable brew, good for a cold night.

Pours dark brown.
No foam, no carbonation.
Aromas are very nice: candied fruit, yeast, roasty malt.
Mouth is a bit smoky, yeast focused with rich English cake-like notes ... but there is no carbonation at all.
Something was wrong with that batch. it will be worth tasting it again.
33cl bottle @ home. Wow what a great beer. Darker than a normal quad. Great taste.

Bottle. Pours brown with a huge beige head. Aroma of malt, soap, spices, caramel, red apples and nuts. Flavor is sweet caramel with some caramel, sugar and spices. Medium to full body, soft carbonation.

Bottle. It pours an almost clear body, dark ruby in color and with a dense, light beige head. Lots of sugar and dried fruits on the nose, some anise, and a touch of roasted malts. The flavor is dominated by dried fruits, with anise, white sugar, dark sugar and some bitterness. Medium to full body, pleasant carbonation. Lasting finish with dried fruits. Certainly a nice one, but not the typical quadrupel. 121102

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours reddish deep brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, dried fruits, alcohol and yeast. Taste is heavy sweet and light bitter with a very fruity and warm finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle shared with lucky husband MichaelBruch. Dark brown to almost black in colour, with creamy head. Very creamy and smooth texture. Taste of rich malt, sweetened espresso, creamy hops, dried fruits and raisins. Really delicious beer.

Bottle - a near black, near perfect beer. This was quality. Lots of liquorice, coffee, chocolate, fruit, malt... oh, so many. Very complex beer, well balanced with a boozy warm kick at the end. Need another now! Waiter!

17th Oct 2012 Brugge: after draught De Garre and Gulden Draak my wife dragged me out of De Garre and into the Red Rose, here I choose a 33cl bottle of this.

Coming in the bottle. the correct glass was offered to me to pour my beer into; I did.

This is a dark, brooding brew: with a creamy head in both colour and texture.

The nose is all about malty molasses: so strong and sweet nothing else got a look in. Luckily the taste wasnt as sweet as the aromas suggested. The malts were certainly the dominant flavour but there is a hop bitterness stopping the beer becoming a malt smoothy and the alcohol doesnt hide away: it is very prominent once the beer has touched your lips.

Looked great and in such a fine bar it is difficult not to score it highly: but Im being objective and truthful in my numbers, it deserves the scores its getting from me.

Botelja. Clear like reddish brown farvi wit a medium beige head, some lacing. Sweet aroma of well toasted malt and caramel with dark fruits, some alcohol and bit chocolate. Good mouthfeel. Sweet flavour, dark maltiness and caramel with dark fruits, alcohol, bit chocolate and a soft bitterness. Sweet finish.

Bottled. Dark and hazy ruby colour, frothy medium-sized head. Aroma is full of dark fruits, dried plums and fermented fruits. A whiff of alcohol mixing with molasses and slightly burnt sugar. Pleasant, coocked perry, banana and colves from the yeast. Dryish yeasty, surprisingly bitter flavor let darker malt and sugar aromas shine. Soft and smooth, deviously light palate. A very well balanced quadrupel.

average frothy light brown head. fair lacing. mostly diminishing. flat thick brown body. aroma: wood alcohol, mild coffee, dark bread, moderate malty. if: moderate sweet light bitter. ff: moderate sweet bitter; long duration. palate: medium body, oily texture, lively carbonation, light astringent moderate alcoholic finish. Dulçor alcoólico, com nuances amadeiradas e background lembrando frutas vermelhas, forte aquecimento alcoólico, não escondendo nada de seus 11%, espuma vaporiza após algum tempo, dando a bela impressão de um latte cremoso, amargor pungente de álcool dá um ligeiro toque salgado ao paladar, charmoso, o final ainda tem uma ligeira reviravolta, trazendo nuances adstringentes ao retrogosto, quase cítricas e acéticas, mas dominadas pelo teor alcoólico. Saborosa, mas a última característica me pareceu defeito em relação a outras grandes representantes do estilo, como a La Trappe Oak Quadrupel, que apresenta maior qualidade geral e gama de detalhes em relação à esta. 18,90. Com vencimento em 11/14, a crescente adstringência não deveria se destacar tanto como fator negativo, conseguindo até mesmo superar o teor alcoólico após o ganho de temperatura da cerveja. Sabor perde dois pontos do inicio ao final da degustação, devido ao ganho de adstringência.60 s
Lækker øl med virkelig god smag! 75Cl flaske med korkprop. Masser af brus og en gyldenrød farve. Rigtig god øl!

This was is a great, complex beer with a great aroma and palate. Flavors kept coming far after the beer travels past your tongue. Enjoy!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled. Amber colour with a beige head. Dark fruits, syrup and yeast in aroma and some dark malts also. Flavour a bit similar with a hoppy bitter finish.

Dark brown pour with a khaki head. Rather roasty nose for a quadruple. Some molasses, a bit of chocolate, and quite a bit of alcohol. There is a decent bit of spice and fruit, though. Tastes a bit boozy, but some good sugar and molasses sweetness. A fair amount of chocolate and roasted malt which give a light bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2013 Flaske fra Belgisk Bryg: mmm, allerede det imponerende skummet smaker forførende, som sjokolademousse. Et herlig snopeøl på alle måter - hvis man like fete belgiske sjokolader og mørk karamell. Mmmmm... I parallelltest med Westvleteren 12 vinner Straffe Hendrik pga flottere skum, saftiger aroma og smak, med et forførerisk helthetsnytelse.

(Bottle, 0.33 l, at Kaisla, 201209027) The beer poured dark brown and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had malts, chocolate, alcohol and fruitiness. Palate was medium bodied and warming with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, malts, chocolate and bitterness. Aftertaste was fruity, malty and bitter. An unbalanced quadrupel. It had tripel and quadrupel charcteristics. Not bad but could have been better. Original rating: 3.6.

After the beer had warmed up the aroma and the taste became dominated by green apples. So, I needed to tune my ratings lower.

33 cL portion at the Halve Maan brewery in Brugge.  Black with a fair head, in bulb glass.  Sweet, candied, with some bitterness.  Smells sweet and a hint roasted.  Tasty but a bit of sweet hiding the alcohol syndrome.

On tap at The Fred. Pours dark brown with a small, beige head. The aroma is figs, molasses, cola, and black cherries. The flavor is very sweet, with a very little bitterness. The palate is medium to heavy, malty, sticky, and fairly carbonated. Overall, this is a delicious, well made beer, with a good flavor and nice mouthfeel.

Tief dunkelmalziger, süßer Duft, Pflaume, Kaffee, Feige, sacht alkoholisch. Antrunk sehr vielschichtig, süßmalzig. Mitte Schokolade, Toffee, alkoholisch wärmend. Abgang schwer malzig, süß ausgeglichen, Früchte, prickelnd. Sehr, sehr gut.
On tap at Bottleworks. Pours hazy ruby with two fingers head. Smell is amazing Belgian yeast, fig and earth. Taste is sweet, standard Abby Quad flavors of fig and raisin. Very nice Quad.

33 cl. bottle poured in to a trappist glass. Jet black with a fluffy tan head. Sweet aroma with malts, caramel, dark chocolate, plums, spices and herbal hops. Taste is sweet. Full body, surprisingly carbonated for the abv., not unpleasant. Finishes long lasting with  caramel malts, chocolate, licorice, port dark dried fruits and a hint of alcohol. Good quadrupel.

Bottle, thanks to MrHangover!
Between dark copper and ruby.
Aroma: malty and light vinous, sushi restaurant/umami, light chocolate, vanilla, red berries.
Taste: malty, brown sugar, light sour with red berries, fruity, vanilla, dry and woody finish.
Above medium-bodied, moussy.
Solid brew.

Bottle from bierzwerg.de. Dark brown color with medium beige head. Sweet bubblegum in aroma with caramel, candied fruit. Taste, sticky sweetness with dates, toffee, molasses, candied fruits, alcohol (brandy?), nice light bitterness in sweet finish. Little bit too much on sweet side, but overall good.

orange hued brew with off white amber head. sweet and mildly fruity with essence of malt it is nearly cloyingly sweet but the fruit keeps it interesting. slick and chewy it is demonstrative and fine beer. sneaky little number.

Nice strong milk chocolate colored head of fine and dense bubbles.  Rich malty aroma with some milk chocolate, sweet malts, raisins and plums.  Color is a deep mahagony brown.  Lively mouthfeel with more raisins, caramel malts and a feint hint of tart cherry.  Light alcohol presence which is quite surprising for an 11% brew.  Surprisingly dry finish with lingering sweet malts and alcohol warming.  A pretty good brew.
Bottle. Brown red with a nice off-white head. Aroma of Candy and spice. Flavour has brown sugar, plums and spices. The alcohol is rampant. Sets your chest cavity alight. Very nice though.

Draft. Chewy is right. Thick clear body. Light brown great lacing. I barely detect any yeast which surprises me. Lots of caramel from the malt to get the high %. Not bad at all. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Opaque dark brown with a big foamy tan head. Darker semi-sweet quad. Burnt chocolate caramel. Charcoal. Cardamom. Black pepper on the tongue. Oak. Plum pits. Medium full body. Complex dark elements prove a good counterbalance to the quad sweetness. Excellent.

(Bottle, Stamine de Garre, Brugge, 17 July 2012) Dark brown colour, almost black, with ruby hints. Creamy beige head. Malty nose with caramel, dried fruit, raisins, dark bread and brown sugar. Malty, slightly toasty taste with notes of caramel, chocolate, dried fruit, brown sugar and a spicy bitterness in a finish with a slight alcohol bite. Full body, quite sweet. Excellently balanced and quite tasty. Very nice.

Pours a hazy golden amber. Smells of Belgian year, candy and dark fruits. Flavor is not as strong as the aroma in terms of the dark fruit flavors. Finish is bittersweet and very warming. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This quadruple is full of flavor with a nutty and bitter aroma to its dark brown complexion with a big white frothy head. It tastes full of flavor with hints of coffee and a palate that lingers on and on!

Bottle - 330ml. Dark brown body with a thin off-white creamy head. Complex malty/hoppy aroma with fruity, yeasty, and brown sugar hints. Alcohol is well hidden. Wonderful, well balanced malty/hoppy taste carries fruity, yeasty, vanilla, and vineous notes. Texture is soft and its bittersweet finish is long and warming. Lovely Quadrupel.

Bottle: &nbsp Deep deep brown, moderate frothy sandy head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Soft dark pitted fruits and apple skin on a bed of bready alcohol. &nbsp Bright and spritzy up front, warming, strong apple skin. &nbsp Not as much dark pitted fruit as the nost suggested, even as minor as it was. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are moderate, seemingly more bubbley than most. &nbsp By the finish there is a bit more dark pitted fruit, but its overshadowed with a champagne like spritzy alcohol flair. &nbsp Pale fruit skin seems to reside start to finish. &nbsp While appearing to be a quad, it comes across as a bit lighter in body, flavor, but not in alcohol. &nbsp Tiz okay, but needs to be heavier and perhaps breadier with more dark pitted fruit in there. &nbsp Glad to have tried it tho. &nbsp Thanks Jason for the bottle!

Bottle at obx.  Poured a dark ruby color with very generous head.  Strong aroma that bursts with dark fruits like raisin, candy, belgium yeast, cherries.  Medium light sweetness.  Finishes slightly dry.  Warming alcohol.  Creamier palate.  Very complex flavors.  Getting dark fruit.  Great belgium sipper.

Pours a cloudy dark brown with a white bubbly head. Aroma is grapes and currant. Taste is bubbly with a deep sweetness followed by a sparkling bitterness and a mellow alcohol burn. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled on tap at PIB, pours a hazy amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, spices, brown sugar and dry notes. Flavour of brown sugar, Belgian spices and slight yeast. Quite complex, with a good dry, low sweetness quality. Very solid.
Ananas, kruidig en  Smaak is noten, koffie maar ook frisheid als wederom wat ananas en perzik. Complex!

I had something calling itself Straffe Hendrik last night, this is the only beer by that name that seems to fit the description. Deep, opaque brown, tastes of coffee, brown sugar, an a slight burnt taste. Very good.

Bottle @Bruges. Dark brown coloured beer with high carbonation and a huge but diminishing tan head. Slight sweet dark fruit aroma, hints of burned sugar and alcohol. Medium body with a sweet malt, slightly roasted flavor. Finish is quite sweety dry.
33cl bottle in de Halve Maan. Pours very dark brown with a solid beige head. Malty toffee aroma. Full-bodied malt and toffee flavour with a solid mouthfeel. Very good.

33cl bottle. Pours dark chestnut brown with billowing tan head that sticks around with decent lacing. Aroma is full of dark fruits: plums, cherries, figs, dates are prominent. Also notes of spices, brown sugar, and a touch of booze. Taste is again full of the deep dark fruits alongside spicy yeast complexity, caramel, deep maltiness, and a definite note of alcohol and hop bitterness. A well balanced quad that doesn't quite hit the heights of its other Belgian peers - still a bloody good beer though.

Tap at SIBF 2012. Pours a murky brown, with sweet dark fruits and baking spices predominant. Lovely, and the flavor follows. Hops on the back, but this is mostly sweet brown sugar and fruit -- similar to pannepot. Just great -- one of my new favorite quads!

Bottle at Boekencafe Schrijvers, Eindhoven. Pours dark copper brown almost black with creamy lasting off-white head. Aroma is very fragrant with malt, caramel, apples, melon, yeast, wine and alcohol with hints of dill and fennel. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Body is creamy with good carbonation. Finish is heavy bitter with licorice, yeast and strong fruity notes. Very good beer!

33cl bottle. Poured dark brown with a lasting beige/brown head. Aroma is fruity, spicy, yeasty and malty, heavy caramel. Flavor is spicy at first, then sugary caramel malt come rushing, then more dark fruits. sweet, alcohol finish. Heavy, full bodied.
12 oz Draft. Pours heavy dark brown with thin head. Coffee and chocolate flavors wonderfully cover up the high alcohol content.

Bottle, with Joe. Poured deep brown with beige head and loads of lacing. aromas of figs, apples, caramel malt, fruity esters. Taste was similiar with a more roasty fruit dominance and some belgian yeast. Finish is sweet and warming.
Wonderfully tangy scent with hints of yeast, raisins, apples and fruit. The taste is the same with a soft tone and warming alcohol. One of the best Abt / Quadrupel I have ever tasted!

Bottled. Pours deep brown with a small, tan head, excellent of lacing left on the glassl. Nose of yeast, dark fruit: figs and plums. Sweet flavor with figs, plums, sweet apples and molasses. Full bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. Great, long lasting finish with alcohol notes. An very nice and complex brew.

Bought a four pack from a supermarket in Belgium as something else to try.  With hindsight I wish I had bought all their remaining stock.  The flavour is of burnt toffee shot through with liquorish with a constant sweetish tang.  I also compared it with a Westvleteren 12 which my partner was drinking.  Were I trying these two in a blind tasting, I might just come down on the side of the Straffe Hendrik.
Very potent. High in alcohol, bit of a burn. Flavour somewhat like coffee and licorice.
UPDATED: JAN 8, 2013 Bottle. Aroma is roasty malt, liquorice, fruity notes. Flavour is roasty liquorice, molasses, yeasty fruit, caramel and fruity and bready notes. Nice.

Bottle.  This beer combines dark brown hues with the reds found in a cola.  It sports a nice layer of tan foam that remains steady.   A nose of rich dark malts and dark fruit.  The first sip brings tasty fruit and then some more aggressive malts.  Raisin is nice and grain is big as is nut bread.   Alcohol is not tasted.  This would be a very nice winter beer with the warming it provides.

Un très joli sigle de bouteille. Nearly the design of the Moonlight Brewing
Company from California. A bucolic corner of the Sonoma Valley for this
one, and the historical medieval city of Bruges for the other one...
But the most important is what you will find in your glass !!!
About the Straffe Hendrik quadruple, we have two things to say first : 
1. A member of the Belgian Family Brewers, and an old story beginning
in 1856 with the family Maes (not the one of the pils producer !!),
and a first mention of brewing in 1546 !!!
2. One of the rare belgian beers with the name of « quadruple », unusual
     in our vocabulary. I have also seen that beer qualified as a barley wine.
Let us see... First of all, a very high level : 11 % abv.
A very dark color, very encouraging...
Une mousse beige qui tient sur le liquide pendant la dégustation, mais à un 
niveau assez bas.
Des arômes superbes de grand brassin : prunes mûres, poire, dattes, figues,
et une pointe de joli porto vintage.
Première bouche magnifique sur les amandes, noisettes, pommes de terre,
petite pointe de coriandre et en arrière bouche lamertume dun bon houblon.
La seconde part sur des notes de cerises noires, de massepain, avec une 
pointe de cognac fins bois. 
On est clairement sur le plan dun barley wine, avec une complexité superbe.
La 3ème vient à une sorte déquilibre mais avec de nouvelles découvertes
gustatives, et en gardant une amertume plus importante que des bières 
brunes fortes dabbaye, qui sont dordinaire plus douces en bouche.
La levure est pourtant très douce, mais à mon avis, elle est en petite quantité
à la refermentation en bouteille, pour donner la priorité au houblon.
Bière originale donc, où on attend la longueur pour poser un diagnostic qui
sannonce chaud...
Dans la première partie de la finale, on a des accents de stout bien construit,
avec une sorte de charbon de bois qui passe très bien la rampe, et saccomode
des autres goûts comme dans un rêve...
Bière donc très structurée, qui révèle un caractère extraordinaire, avec une 
complexité de très grand niveau. On est au top, on le sait, reste la finale, un
très grand moment de tout dégustateur.
Cette finale, comme celle de la Cup en Angleterre, est un very very beautiful
moment... On va dire pour une bière, plutôt la finale du Superbowl....
Bref, vous choisissez selon vos affinités. 
Pour ma part, je reste avec la Straffe Hendrik quadruple, qui me fait la 
meilleure impression, et qui me confirme que nous avons tous les styles de
bière en Belgique, dont un barley wine qui fera très bonne figure..
Un conseil : try it, and after that you see a moonlight brewing in the sky...

All in all better than expected.  The aroma is a bit mild and nothing more exciting than "pleasant", but it is indeed enjoyable.  And the mouth experience is quite pleasing considering the style.  All too often quads are hard to drink due to being too sweet and/or syrupy and/or alcoholic.  Or even sometimes too light and watery with some native Belgian examples where too much candy sugar is used in place of malt.  But this one is in a nice little sweet spot with respect to flavor balance and mouthfeel...its frighteningly quaffable but does not forsake body and malt richness, which is a rare quality.  Maybe just a tad watery, but all things considered it avoids the pitfalls inherent with the style well.  And on the tongue, the 11% seems much more like 8 or 9%.  Not a "wow" rendition but well done.

Deep red-brown colour. Aroma is of sweet, dark fruits and a little port. Very effervescent on the tongue. Texture is thick. General flavour is of strong sweet fruity malts.
bottle from Bierkoning - bedankt. Hazy brownish colour, large head. High carbonation. Caramel, herbs, spices dominate, quite sweet.
Brown colour with a huge creamy beige head. Sweet aroma of dark fruits. Flavor of dark malts and dark fruits added by dark spices. Full bodied with warming alcohol. Winterwarmer.
UPDATED: JAN 9, 2013 Donker bier met dikke kraag. Stevig bier dat vol in de mond ligt en vol van smaak is. Overrijp fruit en port domineren de smaak.

(33cl bottle best by Dec 13 thanks to bu11zeye) clear ruby with thick creamy tan head. Nose of cocoa, dark fruits, not overly sweet, smooth. Taste of alcohol, bite, cocoa, cherry, smooth, other fruits, nice linger, spicy yeast kick, quite drinkable.

33 cl bottle. Dark brown body with an offwhite head that sticks to the glass. Caramel, chocolate and coffee in the nose. The taste has roasted malt, dark chocolate and flavor of coffee in it. Theres a slight bitterness on the background. Great beer!
2011 - 09 - 30 330 ml, 11.2 FL OZ. bottle. amber brown colour. medium creme head.dark fruits and herbs in aroma. light sweet, light bitter, complex taste. good beer !!!

11.2 ounce bottle - hazy purple - clingy, thick lace for something so strong - nose of plum, fig, treacle, vinous notes, doughy yeast - quite a creamy body for the strength - sweet treacle/pudding up front, followed by fairly complex notes of plum, raisin, chocolate - dries out a bit through the middle, bringing notes of spices and dried flowers - finish of fruit skins, spice and an almost barleywine-ish maltiness - nicely balanced and quite tasty.

Fine brown large head deep black. nice warm nose with filter coffee, chocolate and a bit orange, fullbody and fine length, quite soft and lingering around the mouth. taste is lightly bitter chocolate, caramel and a light mix of fruits like apricot, peach. Really pleasant.
UPDATED: NOV 28, 2014 dark brown coloured body with a white head a spicy fruity malty aroma a spicy malty sweet fruity caramel taste with a sweet alcholic bitter finish
Bottle. Pours brown (like Coke), with a large, tan head. Aroma is toffee, fruit, yeast, malt, and brown sugar. Flavor is toffee, malt, dark fruit, and a little alcohol. A pleasant surprise.

Boysenberry and toffee nose. Clear garnet brown, thin tan head. Rich toffee and treacle flavor. Tasteful alcohol presence for a quad. A whisper of peat and oak is there. Boysenberry and plum skin finish. Good transitions, full flavored, full body. A very nice quad.

(bottle) pours a slightly hazy dark ruby colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of dates, wheat, white pepper, grapes and earth. flavour is dark fruits, powdered sugar and caramel over a strong alcoholic backdrop, with a light to medium sweetness. heavy-bodied with average carbonation.

Dark brownish red pour with large fluffy tan head. Aroma of caramel, malt, dark fruit and alcohol. Taste of burnt sugar, caramel, fig and a definite alcohol warmth present. A little too boozy on the dry finish, good beer though.

Bottled sample at the 2nd Annual Top of the Hops Charlottesville, VA beer festival, 9/10/11. Pours a slightly hazy copper-brown color with a medium sized brown head. Decent head retention. Aroma of berries, cherries and brown sugar. The taste is big brown sugar notes, toffee, berries, bready notes and a spicy finish. Medium bodied. Nice.

NDB, NY 11.2oz ($4): Pours a reddish brown that is nearly opaque; it is covered by a pretty head that leaves a thick lacing. Aroma has the Belgian yeast, plenty of fruitiness, and a whiff of liqueur. This is kind of a mellow quad. Fortunately not too sweet and also the alcohol is well covered up and becomes apparent only in the aftertaste a tad. Hops are really on the down low. Dark fruit is most prominent. Leaves a sort of sticky feel in the mouth, but is very palatable in general. Not really the most complex quad in the world though.

Strong alcohol percentage, with its 11%
Although I am not a dark beer favourite, it has a great taste (not too much coffee taste)

Bottle:  The aroma consists of dark fruits, chocolate, candi sugar, spice, and light alcohol.  It pours a dark reddish-brown with some transparency when held to the light and two finger khaki head with decent retention.  There is some sporadic dotting for lacing.  The flavor starts with dark fruits and candi sugar.  The finish has some spice, faint sweet citrus notes, and initially just a hint of alcohol.  As it warms, the alcohol intensifies.  The alcohol isnt overbearing or necessarily hot, but it could be toned down a touch.  Its medium bodied with lively carbonation that manages to come across more soft than prickly.  Overall, a tasty Quad, but not up there with the elites.

Aroma: slik gær rosin citron lime Ud.: kaffesort  E.smag: sød moderat bitter lidt  Krop:fuld For.:cremet  Brus:blød  
75cl 31/5 @døe ho

Poured from bottle, pours a burnt amber with a red hue in the light and a thin head, the aroma is of candy sugar with dark fruit and plum, the flavor is of dark fruit on the front end with a little bit of alcohol burn in the finish, nothing out of this world but still enjoyable.

Bottle.  Reddish brown beer with a strong brownish head.  The aroma is roasted and malty, and the flavour is quite deeply spiced with a gingerness about it and a bitter roasted and malty finish.  Overall a reasonable strongly malty and spiced beer.
Bottle from City Beer. Pours dark brown with a massive beige head and a sourish aroma. There is a rich plum and treacle flavor that is hella tasty. A nice quad.

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours hazy dark brown with a four finger creamy beige head. Aroma of herbs and dark fruits. Full bodied. Flavor of dates andplums. Mild heat. Mouthwatering. Aged malts and earthy hops. Delicious.

26/08/2011 33cl bottle @ home - BB:12/2013 (2011-410) 
clear purple to dark red brown beer, fizzy beige head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of dried fruits, bit of port, orange peel, sweet caramel, heavy on the alcohol, agrum fruits. MF: lots of carbon, medium body. Taste: bitter oranges (like English orange marmelade), sweet malts, caramel, bit musty, fruity, some citrus. Aftertaste: bitter, orange peel, grapefruit, sweet alcohol.
750 ml bottle a dark brown black colored beer with a beige head aroma caramel dry fruits spicy and sugar flavor sweet malts caramel dry fruits sugar spicy and some hops
Flaske: Orange brun klar øl med en stor skumkrone. Meget karbonering. Fin duft af malt og en smule frugt. Smagen er frisk grundet den store karbon ering men stadig en stor maltsødme. Udmærket øl.

Nose has toffee, malts, alcohol and a touch of vanilla.  Flavors are very complex.  I get fruits (pears and oranges), spicey bread, some licorice.  A background of brown sugars, some vanilla, alcohol, and yes even a little coconut.  It has a full body and finishes slighty bitter and dry.  I think this is a great beer and should get a second chance if it was rated poorly.  It is very interesting.

Tallahassee, Fl - Liquor Loft - 750 ml cage corked bottle. Dark chestnut brown pour with a nice sticky khaki colored head that leaves a nice coat of lacing. Pleasant, sweet aroma with hints of brandy, molasses and bubble gum. Bold flavor with some sweet toffee, dates, molasses, some candi sugar notes, a bit of bubble gum, hint of chocolate, brandy and a back end of brown sugar. Mouthfeel is thick and creamy. Very solid enjoyable Quad.

Deep chestnut pour, with a medium sized off-white head.  Tons of raisin in this, with candy sugar, dried dark fruit, clove, nutmeg, and light cinnamon.  The alcohol comes through slightly and is warming.  Like spiced raisin bread.  Decent.

8/20/11. 750mL bottle. Very dark brown pour, quite dark for the style, with red under the light and a small tan head that fades but laces quite a bit. Big burnt sugar aroma with plenty of roast, dark fruits, and a solid dose of alcohol. Sweet flavor with dark sugar, dark fruits, licorice, and plenty of alcohol. Rich, dark, and... not bad.

from Au Grain dOrge, Neuchâtel - hazy ruby-brown colour with a solid dark beige foam; nice lacework; aroma of yeast and pears; very sweet and full-bodied; lot of residual sugars, esters, yeast and more fruity tones

11.2 ounce bottle.  Pours a dark reddish brown with a nice tan head.  Aroma of dark fruit, molasses and yeast.  Taste is malt, dark fruit, caramel, some hops and some alcohol.  Complex.  Very nice after dinner.

33 cl bottle @ Gastopub Tuulensuu, Tampere.
Dark ruby red with a medium beige head. Caramel and dark malts on the nose, notes of licorice and orange peel. Dark sweet malts and caramel on the flavor, orange and some syrup also. Complex, but unfortunately the alcohol dominates too much at the end.
4434

Bottle bought at Noel Cuveliers, Poperinge, Belgium. A dark brown/red coloured pour with a healthy off white head on top. Dark fruit, caramel aroma. Tastes of caramel initially, dark fruit, sweet, yeasty, malty, spice, boozy, bit syrupy and hard to finish though..

bottle, on a terrace in Koolkerke. Nice very dark brown, almost black beer with foamy white head. Smell: alcohol, yeast. Taste: candy sugar, very sweet (maybe a bit too), alcohol. Nice one, but Ive had better abts...

11.2 oz bottle, purchased at Total Wine, Gilbert, AZ.  Pours a beautiful dark ruby red, with big creamy/tan head.  Aroma is pure Belgium. Spicy, fruity, malty and boozy.  Taste is complex; sweet rich malt, with dark fruit and berries, yeast and candy sugar.  Finish is chewy, boozy and smooth.  A real winter warmer. This is what quadrupel is all about!
33 cL bottle:  Appearance is amber brown with slight white head. Aroma is of roasted malt and pale malt. Flavor is of spices and roasted malt with a unique Belgian twist.

750 ml corked and caged bottle poured a clear reddish brown with a lasting tan head. Aromas of toffee, carmel, grape and light cherry. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of toffee, cherry, light earthiness and light tobacco with a smooth lingering toffee finish.

Rating #607, bottle from Toft Vin Islands Brygge  

A redbrown beer with only a small head. Aroma is berries and wood, chocolate, liqourice, though a bit tart and alcoholic as well. Flavor of berries, especially elderberries and blackcurrant, thereupon some chocolate and a bit yeast. A notch of alcohol and medium bitter finish. Thick and creamy palate.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Brownish red hazy brew with an dry sweetbitter taste, warm mouthfeel. Due the heavy alcohol this got not so ridicoulus sweet like some counterparts.

Location: Draft at La Trappe Cafe & Trappist Lounge, 5/11/11


Aroma: The nose is malty, caramel, toffee, some spice, and dark fruits

Appearance: The pour is dark reddish-brown with an off-white head

Flavor: The taste is rather sweet with a fairly light bitterness to it

Palate: The body is medium-full, and this one leans toward the sticky side

Overall Impression: 
I found this one to be a fairly solid Belgian Quad that certainly leans toward the sweet side.  A pretty solid offering, and another interesting one

Bottle. Poured a clear reddish brown color with an average to large frothy light brown head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy dark fruit, Belgian yeast and alcohol aroma. Medium body with a smooth sticky texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy dark fruit sweet flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Solid complex brew.

At Get real NY.  The aroma is a nice combination of fruit and bread. The appearance is deeep brown, light tan head.  The flavor is not as sweet as the aroma.  Fruity and bready to be sure, but a taste of meetal as well.  The finish was actually a little dry, and the booze is felt.  Medium/thick in body.  This beer is all over the map.  Solid aroma, ok in taste, decent body, weird finish.  Good overall.

Bottle.  Very dark brown with red tints and a beige foam.  Aromas are marzipan and coffee with chocolate.  Alcohol with vinous notes.  Flavours are vinous with warming alcohol and marzipan.  Indeterminate malts with, as previously mentioned, strong glue.  Dry berries with berries and pepper to finish.  Weird but decent.

330 ml bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere. BBE 12/2013.
Pours a mahogany colour with a beige head. Aroma of dried fruits, solvent and some malts. Flavour of raisins, sweet dried fruits, bready malts, wood and alcohol. Dry, sticky mouthfeel without carbonation. Warming finish of alcohol, raisins and some wood. Needs aging as the alcohol comes through way too much.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2014 
33 cl bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, BBE 12/2013
Sweetish aroma has some solvent and plastic glue, pear and alcohol. Sweet flavour contains solvent, alcohol, raisins and wood. Warming and drinkable quad, but not very nice due to the sharp alcohol in taste.

7+3+7+3+15=3.5

33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 05/2014
Aroma has raisins, ripe fruits and some sugary tones. Flavour has ripe fruits, some gluey tones, raisins and alcohol. Also some whisky-like wiidy notes. Very foamy palate. Interesting, there is still alcohol and glue present but somehow I like this more.
8+4+7+3+14=3.6

Pours reddish brown with a medium foamy head. Aroma has notes of raisiny malts, apricose and fruits. Slightly stingy and strongly fruity taste with notes of apricose, fruits and alcohol. Smooth finish. Quite well balanced, okay quadrupel.
Dark red brown with a nice smoothy beige head.Sweet,spicy,brown sugar.raisins,dry plum,cinnamon,pepper.vanilla,roasted bread,bitter chocolate,light coffee.Long lasting sweet alcoholic finish.

09-JUL-2011, bottle @Ulkløbben Summerparty.
Red/brown with huge lasting beige head.
